description:
Wow!! This place is something!!  Got here on a weekday a few minutes before 11am and there was already a line!  There were only 5 tables (with 4 chairs each) inside their tight small restaurant, but you could smell the fragrant bbq aroma and actually see real ribs and chicken raw and cooked coming out of the oven!  

I grabbed a combo dinner (1/4 chicken and spare ribs) which came with a baked potato with melted butter, a bread roll with butter, and a salad of your choice(macaroni, potato, bean, or lettuce/tomato).  I also bought 2 cans of coke.  The total came to nearly $19.  BRING CASH!!! it's all over their restaurant to BRING CASH ONLY!!  

I'd say it was a bargain- I was in a food coma!! -  I hadn't eaten anything all morning but my tummy was full to the brim and I could barely get up and leave my table!! :-)  The chicken was sooooo tender and tasted great with the bbq sauce.  The 2 spare ribs were big and they were tender too with lots of meat and tasted just as well with the bbq sauce!!  The baked potato and salad were great with the meat.  If you're ever in the Mission or nearby 20th St/Mission St. and LOVE tender tasty BBQ, come to Pete's BBQ - you will NOT regret it!!  It's certainly a good alternative to burritos/tacos/enchiladas/quesadillas/pupusas in the Mission District.  And if you don't think there's room for you to sit down to eat, for sure, take out is the best way to eat it!!

I didn't see a restroom but that's easily fixable.  Go across the street to Laundre at 2401 Mission St.(cafe in front, laundry in back), pay for a drink of coffee, tea, juice, etc. with your CC and you can use their restroom in back of their cafe.  You may have to ask for the restroom password number.  Laundre is very clean, very spacious with lots of comfortable chairs and sofas & tables and lots of space available and they have great iced cafe latte!!  They even have wi-fi for 2 hour period of time which seemed very slow to me but I was just there to drink their great iced cafe latte, use their bathroom, and hail an uber to my next destination :-)

As far as getting here, from BART, you can take the 14 Mission or 14R Mission or the 49 Van Ness at 24th St BART or 16th St BART since there's hardly any parking. Or take uber or lyft!!
author: Frugal C.

description:
I love going to Petes Barbeque specially when the owner is there because he is very hopeful and also greets you with a smile I love going there for the food as well because it is tasty and it doesn't only feed one person it feeds to my babies enjoy the chicken and the baked potato and my oldest loves to eat the spaghetti

 so you if you're in the mood for chicken but you don't want to cook you should try going to Petes Barbeque and they have dinner plates and items to go ala carte and everything is delicious our favorite items to eat there are the chicken the ribs the macaroni salad the spaghetti
author: Laura M.

description:
This place had all the markings of what a good BBQ place would be, a diner like feel, cash only pricing, friendly staff, but unfortunately the food did not live up anywhere to my expectations.

I had the ribs dinner, and while it was cheap at around $12-13, the ribs themselves were rather cold. The "BBQ" sauce they put on, was more like a salty BBQ-esque flavor rather than the sweeter sauce I'm used to. It was also quite cartilage heavy and don't as juicy and tender as I'd normally like.

The side items were like cafeteria food. The bread was super tough, and not even the ton of butter they put on it could help. The baked potato was fine, and it did benefit quite a bit from the slab of butter thrown on it, but it was nothing special. And the salad was drenched in their Italian like dressing, and was not all that great.

Overall a big disappointment considering this place looked like it would be so good.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Pete's is a go-to for me in the mission. Convenient to get to in the mission, but the hours make me a little sad. I think the best time to come is during standard meal hours, as the food is going to be fresher due to the demand.  

I've probably been here about 4-5 times now. Only once would I say that the meal wasn't what I expected/hoped. Almost always opt for the dinner meal, which comes with a baked potato and bread roll in addition to the meat and salad selection. Honestly don't think I've finished it in one sitting, usually have some to save for another meal. 

The first time I came here I was lucky enough to show up right when the ribs came out from being cooked. Delicious and fell right off the bone. 

My only gripe is they aren't open on Sundays or past 7:30 but I respect that they respect their employees time. It's a shame because it's typically Sundays that I'm craving it!

Also not sure that I'd actually call this a BBQ joint, as only the ribs that I got felt like actually BBQ but the meat and meals are still tasty for what they are.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
I've been going here since I was a little girl and it has never disappointed me. The bbq chicken is tender, juicy, and delicious. I also love the baked potatoes, they're probably my favorite. 
As busy as they always are, they have the seating arrangements to an artform. There's never an issue with finding a seat. Highly recommend!
author: Sandy G.

description: When I'm in the city I always like to stop at Pete's BBQ. There chicken is so tasty, juicy and tender ohh and don't forget to the gravy sauce over the chicken to make the taste more magical. They got other items like ribs and they're also bomb but another good eats that's a must have is the side of spaghetti now this is something you'll never forget and coming back for more. That's just me tho and could be different for other ppl but you won't know until you knock it.
author: Jranel F.

description: None of you reviewers understand what this place is. You come in with preconceived notions of barbeque from other places. This kind of place is a traditional San Francisco Hofbrau, one of the last remaining of what was once a staple for the staples around here. There are plenty of places for your Texas-style blah-blah-blah. This place is local history.
author: Gianni B.

description:
Woof was this place a disappointment. From the outside, this place looks like the real deal. Even the menus on the wall, the cash only bit, and the old timey clock makes this feel like you're walking into a genuine Southern/Midwestern BBQ joint. 

Things go down quickly from there. Cafeteria style serving. Spaghetti (?!). Rotisserie chicken looks good, but... this place is not a BBQ place. The sauce is just the worst. Bland. Feels like it's the stuff at the bottom of a Spaghetti-Os can. Runny. No kick to speak of. Just awful. 

Sides were ok, had a lame Mac side - some sort of weird chickpea based slaw? Bleh. Service was fast and the folks were nice enough. But this just... isn't BBQ.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I was stranded in the mission last night and Uber app nor Lyft app would not open up on my phone, i did not know what else to do and decided to walk back home. In retrospect I was a bit tipsy to come up to this decision but I am so glad it was my last night choice because I had a chance to stumble upon Pete's BBQ!

I walked in looking for a bathroom but stayed when I smelled the BBQ. I ordered two BBQ ribs, and as I walked out I spotted a taxi! My savior! 

At home I was questioning if I should eat it or not, and as the first taste of the succulent meat I was blown away! It's so good! I ended up eating both ribs last night even though I wanted to save one of the ribs for my partner. 

I woke up planning to go back to the Foreign Cinema and retrace my steps so I can find the ribs again but thanks to google maps I now know the exact location of my new favorite BBQ!
author: Anelya S.

description: I was sick at home this week and was craving ribs, so I decided to try out Pete's in my neighborhood! I got the 1 lb of spare ribs for about 10 dollars (cash only). The bbq sauce wasn't really barbeque, but the ribs themselves hit the spot! They had a good amount of meat on them and tender, although not fall-off-the-bone. For the price though, I thought they were pretty good!
author: Yeva Y.

description:
The eats are good, the eats are cheap, all of this, thanks to Pete's.

My friend and I got ourselves a huge plate of BBQ spare ribs for $10.79. The prices of other entrees and sides are modestly priced as well--take a look at Ed U.'s menu picture for the deets.

This hole-in-the-wall not-so-authentic joint ain't serving up fall-off-the-bone ribs, but there's a nice variety of fat and chew to keep all cheap eaters amused. The homemade BBQ sauce that's offered at the end of the lunch cafeteria line is free and is worth a try. Tangy!

CASH ONLY.

Cheap plates of meat that can't be beat--that's Pete's!

goshdangit why is his name so catchy.
author: Adele F.

description:
With all the designer barbecue in town like Southpaw and 4505, it's hard to see how Pete fits into that artisan landscape. Even Austin's fabled Franklin BBQ had a two-night pop-up at Smokestack earlier this year that apparently made "Soylent Green" look like a country club dance. I guess it doesn't really matter because Pete's is not really a barbecue place despite the name because there's no smoker or rotating rotisserie rack that I could see. Everything's presented cafeteria-style like a Luby's, and frankly that ain't a bad thing if you're not picky about how you want your barbecue. It's solid, finger-sucking eatin' for sure, and I'm pretty sure that's Pete himself carving up the ribs at the beginning of the line.

Jamie W. and I had been hanging out at the revitalized north side of Dolores Park when we felt an urge for ribs but nothing that would force us to wait for hipsters to finish their plates. I've never tried Pete's before, but I figured this might do the trick on a Saturday evening where every other eatery was crawling with high-octane twenty-somethings. Pete's definitely doesn't attract them. The target customer base consists of large families who huddle around the chipped formica tables and large guys who order big bags of meat to go. Jamie and I both ordered the $10.79 Spare Rib Dinner where Pete chops up five ribs a plate and ladles on the not-quite barbecue sauce. We pushed our trays down the line where the ladies take over.

We each got a baked potato and a big roll with a scoop of butter. Too bad the roll was cold as the butter looked like wallpaper paste when we slathered it on. We each got our own side. Jamie got the bean salad, but I apparently felt I needed more taters since I went for a scoop of potato salad (photo: http://bit.ly/1K8NyTa). The ribs were decent enough and quite meaty, more than enough for the price if you ask me (photo: http://bit.ly/1NyAGM5). The baked potato was a little harder to dig into than I wanted, but it was nothing that a dollop of butter couldn't resolve, while the potato salad was Sunday picnic-good. We were surprised we secured a table since the big families were pretty territorial, but it all worked out. Like I said, it was finger-sucking good.

FOOD - 3 stars...not really barbecue in the smokehouse sense but a rib-sticking cafeteria for sure
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...chaos at dinner time, grab a seat the moment someone gets up
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...the staff knows what they're doing
TOTAL - 3 stars...you better be hungry...and not all that picky
author: Ed U.

description: The chicken is very nice, also the green salad and mac cheese!!! We would like to try the ribs next time!
author: Annabelle P.

description: They need to take the name Bar-b-Que off this building, because NOTHING is barbecue....it's warmed over food cooked in an oven....if you want bbq come to KC, Texas, Nashville anywhere else Accept this place.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Pete's BBQ looks like a place to get ham, turkey or bbq chicken with all the fixings (sides) $12ish.

ordered a sausage sammie (4.75) got sausage only (2.39)
-lack of communication somewhere
sausage listed under take out, maybe.
-sausage tasted good, didn't need the carbs from bread anyways.

take outs:
-short line at lunch time.
author: Victor G.

description:
I am not quite sure what others are eating there but to call this place a BBQ spot is a bigtime stretch. The sauce (which to me is always BOSS!) is completely bland and uninspired tomato soup. Best to just go with the rotisserie chicken in my view and forget the sauce. There's no tang, smoke, or spice detectable in the flavor which should be a staple of traditional BBQ - at least coming from someone who grew up much of his life in bbq havens and having visited the great BBQ meccas of America (Memphis, Texas, Kansas City and St. Louis to name a few). The ribs looked almost steamed and not smoked or grilled. And the sides were likewise subpar - for example, the spaghetti (spaghetti?!!!!! In a bbq joint?!!!) looked straight out of a chef boy r dee can. Needless to say my entire family, despite our great anticipation, left the place somewhat crest-fallen and we had to console ourselves at a local tacqueria to feel better about our outing. 

I suppose to each his own but I gotta say Yelp reviews really let me down on this one. Needed a good neighborhood BBQ spot and alas my search continues.
author: Robert R.

description:
When I first move to SF in 1989, I lived in the Mission and used to go to Pete's frequently.   Loved it!  Now I go there from time to time to get a sandwich.   I have been getting ham and turkey combo.  Very basic but tasty.  I agree that this place is more like a hof brau (like Tommy's Joynt) than a BBQ restaurant (not there is anything wrong with that!):
Bottom line, good basic meats, hand carved by friendly staff, cheap and non-frills.  Don't go here for traditional BBQ or expect anything fancy.
author: alex m.

description:
2 stars with sauce, 3 stars without.

Seriously, B.Y.O.B. (Bring Your Own BBQsauce). When dude puts meat on your plate then goes "Do you want sauce on it?" do yourself a favor and be like awwheeeyyyllnah.

It's not BBQ sauce by any means; it's closer to TV dinner gravy or a light version of Irish brown sauce. It's miles away from being any sort of BBQ sauce, however you look at it.

Yet the meat cuts were deece. Ribs were the meatiest & right-texturest I've had in a while. It was also the most food for the lowest price I've had in a while: quarter chicken + 3 ribs + halfbaked #neeearrdebeeech potato + coley + bread roll + agua = $11.95, $14-something after tip. iBuen valor!
author: Dan B.

description:
Pete's is kind of cafeteria-ish. No fine dining here - heck, no BBQ here. This is all rotisserie stuff, as you can see in the front window.

Food's solid enough (and cheap), but it is certainly nothing fancy. If you go for one thing, go for the chicken.
author: Casey S.

description: I've been going here since I was a wee lad. They cover the BBQ basics. Good ass chicken, ribs and roasted turkey. You can literally see this roasting at the front door. The best is their macaroni salad is one of my favorites. I always ask for extra BBQ sauce for my chicken. The only thing that is not so great is parking! Definitely check it out!
author: Karla G.

description:
tender ribs, juicy chicken, tasty sauce that doesnt overwhelm the flavor of the meat. 
they give you a big slab of butter for the fluffy potato.
coleslaw was creamy and crunchy.
bread was on the cold and stiff side.
all for $12!!! not bad. its not super tasty like its gonna blow your mind, but for $12 this is all win!

cash only!
the line moves quicky.
seating is limited.

this place harks from the old school era of the mission before the hipsters and techies. just good bang of the buck for the people!  owner is an nice old man cutting the meat!
author: Jason C.

description:
OMG! So much food! If you don't mind gaining a few pounds, this is the place for you. Tried a bit of everything. I would say that the sausages are meh but everything else  is great.

There can be a line and there aren't a ton of tables.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Love this place been coming here's since I was a little ribs are the bomb!! Thank you for still existing !!
author: Jonathan B.

description: This place has great chicken, ribs, everything is fresh, always been a favorite, great prices, been around for years
author: Chaparral A.

description:
This is everything I've ever wanted ribs to be but didn't know they could be. Fresh off the grill, it was crispy and the perfect texture and the meat just melted off the bone. The bbq sauce was the best I've ever had. I think they make it themselves? Not sure. 

Prices were a little steep for such a homey laid back decor within, but it's SF. 

Definitely going back!
author: Ning T.

description:
Sloppy, not quite as good as Tommy's Joynt. Cash only.

Pleasant staff.
author: Inigo M.

description: I hit this place when I'm in the bay area. It's so good! The sauce is not like others that are sweet or tangy. This sauce is...savory with a little sweetness.
author: Kelly C.

description: The best rotisserie chicken by far! Moist with crispy skin! I find their rotisserie potatoes are perfectly done! I get them drenched in butter! Great & hearty salads!
author: David L.

description: Had Pete's today for the very first time off of a colleague's recommendation and man was it delicious! I had the ribs, chicken, and hotlinks.  Everything was super juicy and tender, and furthermore, for a barbecue joints the place is reasonably priced. Dear fellow Yelpers. this place is definitely worth a visit.
author: Jen M.

description: I think this place is great  because it has pretty much what I want in a restaurant - good food and good service. I been a big fan for a couple of years and I love the food here as much as any place I eaten at anywhere I been. I eat out seven days a week because I can't cook worth a bean but Pete's does the cooking for me so there!
author: Carl J.

description:
A little over-rated. The chicken was good, but not that special. The turkey and the beef were both really dry. The spare ribs were ok, The potatoes were good. The drippings from the chicken are used to season the potatoes during cooking. The food was a bit greasy and had lots of sodium.

Overall, it was a good value, But 4 - 5 stars for this restaurant is a little high.
author: John S.

description: Came in when they had run outta ribs, was told to wait 20 mins for more. Got some for takeout and came home to eat, two hours later I'm sick from undercooked meat. Thanks, Pete.
author: Matt T.

description: Gus is quite the sandwich artist. My pal took me here and I was pleasantly surprised by the high quality food, reasonable price, and amazing sandwich making abilities. I went with the turkey and asked for BBQ sauce in place of mustard. The sauce was incredible, and the thick cut pieces of turkey were moist and delicious. The slaw was also a tangy and delicious side dish. I will be back soon, I'm curious about that whole chicken for $9, seems like a great option. This place is a hidden gem.
author: Alex E.

description:
Is a little place on Mission street, the barbeque or the Roast Beef & Turkey sandwich !!! AWESOME

For a sandwich + soda is like 10 bucks
author: Michael L.

description: This place is so good! Awesome barbecue, huge portions, great price, and wonderful service. A mission gem. I got the spare rib plate and my friend got the chicken plate. We shared and will have lunch for tomorrow still. The green salad and beer salad mix is awesome. Cash only.
author: Jordan H.

description:
Chicken & Ribs = HITS THE SPOT! 

What More Can I Say? Not Selfish To Splat That BBQ Sauce Either!
author: Cynthia S.

description:
Best, best chicken ever!!! Every food item that is sold here is so so good! The ribs are very tasty one if the best. 

The customer service at this location is not the greatest, the 2 men that are always there serving seem so grumpy and it feels as if they are obligated to serve the customers, remember that the customers are the ones that make or break a place!!!! The ladies at the register never smile, never seem friendly, just plain horrible service.

The parking is the WORST as it is in most areas in the mission district. 

Overall, the food is great.
author: Rosa R.

description:
We were strolling on Mission yesterday and found parking easily on a beautiful afternoon......

Across the street, we noticed this small place filled with folks.....

As we lined up, all the tables were full, so we decided to ask and share....

We both ordered half a chicken, comes with a side, we got beets and potato salad, and it comes with buttered bread.....besides, it was served by the cutest young man with baby blue eyes, still day dreaming.....lol

The food was pretty good, tasty bbq sauce, not overwhelming, the bread was a tad much for us.....

Very reasonable prices, about 11 bucks each....great deal and nice people all around, especially the one that allowed us to share a table....
author: Leslie Y.

description:
The Chicken & ribs with a bit too dry even with the sauce. Baked potato just okay but they pre-buttered it & the roll.
Mac salad was good.
Wouldn't go back again- my curiosity was satisfied.
author: Ashley G.

description: It smelled great and looked good, but the running sauce was not BBQ sauce. Chicken could've used some seasoning , spaghetti was blah!!!!  Salad was good. Next time just the chicken and salad. My friends said they grew up eating Pete's back when they grew up in the 80's and was great. Don't know what happen to it over the years. Maybe cut backs.
author: Mary V.

description: I love this place.  The chicken and baked potatoes are AMAZING. The price is super cheap and the staff are really nice.  The only downside is that the salads are not very good, so I usually skip out on them when I go.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Typical rotisserie dinner you would find. 

It's 11am. Chicken and meat on display in the window, the fat dripping down witch each rotation, slathering the potatoes and other meats below. You feel the heat on your face as you walk past the display to get inside. 

You have Pete himself right at the start of the counter as you come in. Choose the meal you want and he'll be right there cutting it up for you.

Move down the line and pick your sides to go along with the baked potato they give you. 

Don't expect anything fancy from the baked potato or bread. Just like other rotisserie places I've been to, you get a standard potato with a chunk of cold butter slathered in. 

Bread is not toasted or warmed and also has a chunk of cold butter slathered on. 

The main point of the meal is the meat. 

I had the half a chicken order with a ladle-full of sauce. 

As typical with other places, you have the ends of chicken dry and the skin cracking from being too close to the heat source but as you get closer to the center, the chicken becomes more palatable. 

It's no lemon-garlic infused chicken with herbs you'd find at newer style rotisserie places and it's definitely not pretty to look at, but the meal gets the job done when you just want chicken with some tangy sauce.
author: Mike Q.

description:
I think people should realize that SF does not have real estate to support restaurants having a smoker. So those people being snobs about it should let it go. 

Proportional to the price, this place is pretty good. Half a cornish hen and four plus side for $11 is a great deal. The plate fed both of us and it was our only meal of the day. The ribs were decent but the chicken was really tender.
author: Huey N.

description:
Food is ok.  Ribs were salty. :( 
Potato salad =  rocked.
Prices = reasonable.
Service = friendly
author: Fannie S.

description:
If you know good ribs, stay away. The only thing good about the ribs is that they're tender (most parts of them anyway). Flavour (even with the sauce) was just salt... not the tangy, wonderfully marinated meat you'd expect. Just salt. They aren't smoked either, or if they are, it's undetectable.

For $10 a pound, you should get them if all you care about is eating cheap, and mostly tender meat. Otherwise, you can make better ribs at home. If you want amazing ribs, I have no suggestions for you in this city yet. It has been disappointing.
author: Malini D.

description:
I'm giving a one star for the service! The food is always amazing(went once before).  Me and my brother and some friends went to get some food from here since we were In town. We ordered 2 chickens, ribs and potatoes to go. 

Since  theirs  not a lot of tables, we got the food to go but when we were leaving, people left from one table and so we decided to eat there. As we were sitting down, (Pete) the man started screaming !

"You have To go, I asked you if it was for here or to go, I charge more if you eat here! I'm sorry but you gotta leave........." Screaming loudly and getting super red!!!!

We honestly didn't even know that is was more money to eat there, and we could of easily paid the difference. But it really SUCKED that PETE put me and my whole group on the spot!!!!! He started screaming and everybody was watching!!!! 

 We weren't trying to save a few bucks, but he took it as if we were trying to play him, it's disappointing that you get food and get treated like THIEFS in front of everyone. So we just left to not be on the spot any more!!

Petes a Jerk
author: Carlos G.

description: So yummy! And the price is right; where else can you get a pound of ready to eat barbecue ribs for under $10?
author: Ilana P.

description: The place to go if you're looking for a small place with a family vibe! The staff is wonderful, they've kept it in the family and it's nice to see the same familiar faces I grew up seeing here. I've always gotten the same order and it never fails me, ribs covered in BBQ sauce with spaghetti a baked potato a side salad and a roll of soft bread with butter.
author: Jen H.

description: As know for, Pete's BBQ still continues to serve outstanding pork BBQ.  Although parking is always a challenge around that area, its well worth the hassle looking for a meter.  Keep up the good work Pete.  Thx much.
author: Jaime L.

description: The place looks like a hole in the wall.  I can't believe the place actually got a 90+ score from the health department, but that's what the sign says.   They did not let even customers use their bathroom.   Everything served cafeteria style, kind of like dorm food.  I ordered half a roast chicken.   It comes with two sides: a mandatory baked potato and a salad of your choice.   The chicken was unfortunately way overcooked and very dry, which is a common problem for roasting chicken.   It cost $10.50 which I thought was a little high given the neighborhood and the lack of decor and bathroom.   I have no desire to return.
author: Will T.

description:
Food 4 The baked potatoes are amazing!! with butter, sour cream and chicken fat from rotisserie... just so tasty! 
Ambience 3 Most customers order for to-go. 
Service 4 
Price 5+
author: Tory T.

description:
Portion is great!  If you're in town, on a budget and can spend about $11.00, then this is the place for BBQ fixin...

The only negative thing is they only take cash and didn't see any bathroom.

Other than that, dig in and get out and explore SF.
author: Ritchie L.

description: This is not BBQ. Chicken and ribs are dry NO seasoning. Potato was gross, no seasoning. Definitely not worth the price or time to find a parking space.
author: Monica M.

description:
The food is very tasty but one of the women behind the counter is Rude as hell! She's like the Soup Nazi, doesn't ask what you would like she just looks at you like What?
Go in say what you want to move down the line.
author: Mickey M.

description: Ok.  In terms of large portions, cheap prices, and an old school quaint atmosphere not yet discovered by hipsters, this place gets a 3 or 4.  I tasted some chicken and it was good.  I ate the 3 bean salad, which was salty, but I like salt and overall it was good...the thing that grossed me out was the handling of the raw meat...quite a few raw chickens sitting in a grey tub under a counter waiting to be placed in the rotisserie oven and raw rib fingerprints all over the fridge...smudges...so the overall cleanliness turned me off...but the customers were locals, friendly, and the place has been there 40 years, quite a San Francisco institution.
author: Tamara G.

description: Hands down best rotisserie chicken baked potatoes macaroni spaghetti and roast beef sandwiches ahhhh man guuuuud! Bin going here since I was a little kid defenately a hidden food gem this spot deserves a food show spotlight
author: Latuya W.

description: We normally have Petes just for the holidays, but just had to pick some up while I was in my old neighborhood with my babe. It was so heart warming seeing the original guys still roasting just like when I was a kid, we'd come down the block with my folks and just load up during the holidays, eyeballing the chickens on the spit, munching on some fresh baked rolls from the little bakery 4 doors down. damn I miss those days.. anywhoo best friggin roast bbq chicken and ribs ever!!!, no one can replicate
author: Teresa L.

description: Listen up you hipster shits, Pete's is the real deal. Go cry about the virtues of artisinal bbq while the rest of  us help ourselves to the taste of America.
author: William T.

description: I had the roast beef sandwich for lunch. It was nice and filling. Could have been more flavorful and more aggressively seasoned, though. I'd come back to give it another shot. Friendly service.
author: Elbert C.

description: My friends decided on having Pete's BBQ today. I immediately thought of Everett & Jones so my mouth began to water. I've never experienced Pete's but thought if I get the same items I get at Everett & Jones I couldn't go wrong. Welp, I was wrong. I told my friend I wanted links and potato salad (two friends went while I stayed at the office). Expecting to get bread with it, I didn't. Maybe they ate mines...who knows lol. But my links weren't off the grill. Very disappointing! And they weren't regular mild links. The potato salad was okay. I like to drizzle mines in bbq sauce but their sauce wasn't a firecracker in my mouth. Maybe I'll try it again in the future. But I'll definitely need to go next time so I can actually see what their food looks like before putting my bid in on an order.
author: Itika D.

description:
Really good chicken and potatoes for real cheap.

I'm not in love with the sides but am in love with the place
author: Peter M.

description:
Hot stuff.

On one side of the street there is this: http://www.yelp.com/biz/bikram-yoga-in-the-mission-san-francisco-2?hrid=J8S061aIn9J7aLpBDQ1UAw

On the other side of the street there is this: Huge freshly roasted turkey sandwiches on a roll. Rotisserie chicken quarter dinners with baked potato, bean salad and bread.

Both can (and should) be doused with homemade BBQ sauce.

Both are absolutely delicious.

Both are served in an old school cafeteria style line.

Both are just $8.

That's hot.
author: Jason B.

description:
I really liked this place, it's old school retro, just the way I like it! there arent many places like this around these days, reminds me of cafeteria or hofbrau style restaurant, nothing fancy, old tables, old fashion decor, has lots of character, they make excellent barbecue and the service is also excellent, the owner serves it himself with a friendly smile, I thought the food was pretty good, the ribs were cooked perfect and the servings were very generous, I was very full, almost couldnt finish it, a very satisfying meal

I like it better than Tommy's Joynt
author: Mr Bolo B.

description: I am not sure where to even start. I will simply say that it is not Barbeque. If forced to define it in simple terms I would say that it is closest to a cafeteria.
author: Tom C.

description: Hands down the best chicken in the SF Bay Area!!!! Can't go wrong with ordering anything on the menu, it's all delicious!!!!
author: Sergio L.

description: I liked their chicken and ribs, i wish they had more seasoning, but otherwise it's a good barbeque. There are a lot of choices on the menu. My friend ordered sausage and did not like it. People who work here could use some training at customer service. It feels like they are doing you a favor by just being there. Very ignorant and not friendly.
author: Kris B.

description:
I so love this place.

I stumbled upon it one day while in the Mission.

I cannot recommend it enough.

I real deal and a bargin.

And the Sauce!!  It is magic and maybe BBQ crack sauce.

The place is small with a few tables and usually a line for service.  You can order to go to.  The lines moves fast.  The staff are friendly and nice.
author: Daniel P.

description:
A true gem in the Bay Area for good, inexpensive bbq FOR TAKEOUT (would never dine in). To all the people who complain about the sauce: there isn't a damn thing wrong with the bbq sauce here. Fact is, bbq sauce comes in a lot of different varieties, from vinegar-based on the east coast to more tomato-based in Tennessee to dry rub in Texas, and lots of variation in between.

I had the chicken and ribs combo. Meat was tender and delicious. Came with a baked potato, a choice of salad, and a roll. I got cole slaw and paid for an extra side of potato salad, both of which were good. Had to pay 10 cents extra for sour cream for the baked potato. Also comes with buttered bread roll. All in all, I spent $14.50 and had enough food for two people to get stuffed. Very fast service.

Would definitely go back.
author: P U.

description:
This place has some amazing food! I work half a block away so I come here for lunch. They have great service and you get your food super quickly! 
Chicken A+ 
Salad A+
Sandwiches A+
author: Jose G.

description:
It's not BBQ. It's rotisserie chicken with some sort of non-traditional bbq sauce.  It's not bad just not what we were expecting. There is no smokey flavor or tangy bbq sauce. No tasty southern sides like you'd expect at a real bbq joint. 

The chicken was very moist though.
author: Shara H.

description:
This corner Barbeque joint has been around a long time. How long?

My dad (Rest in Peace) used to take me here when I was little.

Also to go further back in time, I recently saw an episode of Streets of San Francisco. This is also one of Lieutenant Mike Stone (Karl Malden...RIP!) and Inspector Steve Keller's (Michael Douglas) favorite place to eat on the show. I wish Yelp was around in the 1970's, so they can type up a review of the places they ate or investigate.

Well, I have carried my dad's torch and took my daughter to this "Old School" Barbeque place for a early dinner. We split an order of the Chicken and Rib combo. For $10.99, you get a quarter of a Rottiserie-cooked Chicken (Leg and Thigh) four tender Pork Ribs, a side (we got potato-salad), baked potato, and a roll. All the meats and the Russet Potatoes are cooked in the rottiserie cooker and making the meats very delicate and tender. 

But despite having friendly service and tasty meats, our potato salad was too watery with a soup-like texture. Also, they spread "way" too much butter on our baked potato and roll. The lady actually scooped the butter to our sides, like scooping Ice Cream to a cone. The amount of butter is over-exceedingly too much for us. We may enjoy butter, but save the butter for Paula Deen's show. 

Cash only, ya'll!
author: Matt G.

description: My favorite spot in San Francisco so far. The portions are HUGE, a real man meal without a doubt.  So much more unique than than the 100 Mexican places in the mission also
author: Aljosha N.

description:
I can almost say I grew up eating their chicken. While growing up in the Mission, I walked by this place all the time. And man, the smell of them roasting their chickens is the best food smell ever. I really don't know what they put in their bbq sauce but if you tell me it's crack, I would believe it. 25 years later, I'm still craving for their chicken!

It's not the best looking place. It still looks like it did 25 years ago so don't go for the decor, go for the CHICKEN! Or you can always just get take out. Ask for extra bbq sauce. YUM!
author: Andy W.

description: I love this place! Great hand craves sandwiches! Fresh roast beef, turkey and ham. The chicken special is also a great choice. The workin mans spot. No pretentiousness here. Just a solid spot to get served quick. Never disappoints always consistent.
author: Nina R.

description:
I was around the Mission today to get a B12
Shot... I had a chicken plate rubbed with a "Very Delicious Barbecue Sauce"...
I find the chicken of this place healthier then the one I used to  buy at whole food for 3years in the row.. But at Pete's barbecue  everything was pure good.. They offer you a side salad,tomato-cucumber-cilantro-lettuces and a light dress made with Apple cider vinaigrette" it helps on the digestion part" very clever idea.. And a piece of homemade bread..  I'm watching my carb, so I  eat half potato and half the bread..
I took the butter out.. And I felt full until I hit the gym 2 hours after the eating..
I'll be back soon...
author: Pedro D.

description: I love barbecue and this place has good portion but not your southern style barbecue.  The sauce is runny and the baked potato only comes with butter. The prize is good.  I would go back without getting barbecue sauce.
author: Maria G.

description:
In reviewing George's B.B.Q. on 24th recently I came across other reviewers who had stated similarities between George's and Pete's.  Since I liked George's I had to check out Pete's for myself.  

The first two things I noticed when I walked into Pete's Barbeque is its popularity and its old school diner décor.  The place was packed during a late weekday afternoon.  I'm not certain how long Pete's has been around but judging by its interior I'd have to guess it's been a long time.  The place just has a rundown feel to it with its faded walls, formica table tops, vinyl chairs and foot mouldings that are literally peeling off of the wall.  Don't look up on the ceiling because the black dust cobwebs that have adhered itself to the flourescent lights just might make you think twice before ordering your food to eat in.

The food spread looked nearly identical to George's with all of the hot rotisserie meats laid out, spaghetti with Polish sausages arranged across the top and pan after pan of chilled side salads for your choosing.  They have slices of cheesecakes and pies on individual plates displayed just like George's too.

For my initial visit to Pete's I duplicated my initial visit to George's by ordering the Roast Beef dinner served au jus.  The lady doing the carving asked me how I preferred my beef.  I told her I liked my beef medium then she proceeded to carve up some of the rarest slices I've come across.  She sliced the beef thin too, but she did take the time to trim away any excess fat.  It turned out to be a monster portion of rare and medium rare slices along with the buttered bake potato (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gKaBgL0FS7JBjBAKU69foA?select=V_0Az5S95lOlXrOsw6jdrw), roll and butter and the macaroni side salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gKaBgL0FS7JBjBAKU69foA?select=Dw_dChXZHfnh5YW66bWRjQ).  The pool of juice actually made the super thin slices of meat cold as I noticed hot steam from the beef during the carving process.  

In addition to being cold the beef was tough too.  I guess I should have expected that with some of the raw beef that was carved up.  The overly-buttered bake potato was very good as was the creamy macaroni salad which I liked a bit more than the one at George's because it was properly chilled. 

I returned for a second visit days later and ordered a Chicken dinner.  Pete's does very good rotisserie chicken too.  Tender, moist meat is encased under a crispy, flavorful skin.  I enjoyed the chicken much more than I did the roast beef.

Pete's menu doesn't offer pastrami, brisket or combination plates and his prices are slightly higher.  Since both Pete's and George's had hits and misses with their meats I'd rather stick to George's for a cleaner, less-crowded environment and lower prices.  Pete's does deserve a solid 3.5 stars however.  If you're a meat and potatoes type person like I am you probably can't go wrong at either restaurant.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: While I have never eaten here, the pungent smell from the dish area that wafts thickly onto 20th street assaults my nose daily. Often times I think of how scarred the lungs of the neighbors must be. If you like the idea of a chlorine meat cocktail I'd encourage you to walk by!
author: Lars Z.

description: I have Always been going to eat bbq here when i was a kid....  it was pretty good. So I decided to go today after not going for a while since i was in the neighborhood and found parking  and I was pretty dissapointed.The chicken and ribs were pretty dry, luckily I asked for extra barbecue sauce. But I don't think I will be going back, the macaroni salad was pretty bland I remember it being very tasty! And to add more to my review I had a Coke and it was flat. But if  you're here in the neighborhood and want a quick lunch and don't mind the taste then go for it ....the bread is pretty good.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Time warp.

I remember staring into hofbraus as a kid, eyeing the roast beef, rotisserie chickens, etc. Mom never took me though, this wasn't our family's style of cuisine I guess.

Fast forward to today. Just finished working out. Hungry. Need protein. I couldn't have come to a better place. No frills, meat and potatoes, literally.

I ordered the whole chicken, beet salad for some veg, and man did that macaroni salad look tempting. Chicken was perfectly seasoned, HELLA juicy, and skin cooked perfectly. ~$10 later, muscles and stomach both happy.

Mom don't always know best. LOL!

Caveat: This is not  a "BBQ" joint per se, in fact, I think they should change the name so people don't expect smoked stuff. Just roasted meats (chicken, ribs, turkey, brisket) and potatoes. and CHEAP!
author: Derrick V.

description:
The best word to describe Pete's...retro!! It's like walking into a time warp. Not many places serve like this anymore. You walk in and Pete asks you what kind of meat you'd like. They have all kinds. I chose the chicken based on Yelp reviews. You get a baked potato or spaghetti, salad (3 or 4 to choose from) and a huge roll for under $10. The chicken was very moist. I did get the barbeque sauce and felt as if it was unnecessary. It really didn't have much flavor. The portions are large. I usually don't eat white bread but the roll seemed to be homemade and actually had texture and flavor. My husband had the roast beef sandwich and it was huge. 

There isn't a ton of space to sit especially since it was super busy when we were there on a Saturday afternoon. Tons of families were there. Also seems like a lot of people get take out. 

Don't expect fancy but you can expect good food at a very inexpensive price and a San Francisco nostalgic feel!
author: Rachel M.

description:
Okay, all you people who rated this place 4+ stars need to go to Texas or Kansas City and have some real barbecue.

This place was okay for hot, fast, and decently priced. That being said the ribs themselves really didn't have any flavor but at least the sauce was good. I don't know that I would have been able to finish the ribs without the sauce though.

The house salad was fine, nothing to rave about but not bad and the baked potato was a little dry.

Not someplace I think I'll go again.
author: Vanessa J.

description:
I've been coming here since the early 90's. Although I have tried the bbq chicken, which is quite good, and the baked potatoes which are amazing, there is nothing better than their sandwiches. 

Piled high slices of either freshly carved turkey or roast beef with lettuce, tomato, and mayo, on a delicious roll.

I would take a quarter of a star away, but just for the location. It's not easy to find parking, depending on the hour it could be a little dangerous to walk around, etc. But regardless, to eat one of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten anywhere, it's worth the little inconveniences!
author: Mauricio S.

description: Even thought this place says Barbeque, its not a BBQ place at all. Both their ribs and chicken didn't look very good so instead ordered a sandwich and boy was that a mistake. The bread was really thick and dry, even with what looked like plastered on mayo and mustard. I doubt I would go back here.
author: Richard L.

description: My mom ate here while she was pregnant with me. I grew up eating here. Pete and his family have perfected their craft. Decent prices. No frills restaurant. Extremely tasty food. Long-live old school Mission District businesses.
author: Yelper F.

description: Huge portion sizes for their ribs at good value, and I mean it. I love their giant potatoes drizzled with butter.
author: Vhalerie L.

description:
I think they put drugs in their food because it's that good and keeps me coming back for more. I have only gotten their quarter chicken deal for $6.75 (about 20 times) and will continue to get it. With the spaghetti in place of a baked potato, though those and nice with crispy outside, and the three bean salad, or ensalada de tres frijoles. 

Just like everyone says, the slow roasted chicken falls of the bone with flavor, even the white meat is moist and plentiful, needs nothing extra. Except, of course, extra bbq sauce. The three bean salad is super flavorful and has pieces of onion, carrot, and cilantro in a delicious oil and vinegar and herb dressing. I buy just that sometimes to take home and share with my veg sister. A half pint is never enough, I can always scarf down more. 

I have tried all the "fancy" BBQ joints in the city, as well as the trucks, while some were great, some failed miserably, this place is always consistent, friendly, simple, fast, and affordable. The only reason I am giving 4 stars is because of the lacking atmosphere, but it is no frills counter service.

I am a southern girl who loves some good BBQ, and Pete's takes me home.
author: Marina M.

description:
Attention: man heaven has been found. All hail.

$6.99 for chicken, macaroni salad and buttered bread? They even slather the bread with butter for you! Sure it wasn't that really nice french-style butter I got at RNM last month, but it's melt in your mouth goodness nonetheless, right?

Seriously, any place that uses a scissor to cut the ginormous portions they dole out is a-ok in my book.

My humble suggestion: bring a date. If she smiles at the sight of rotisserie goodness, she's a keeper. 

If she gives you her death look, get rid of her.  

Oh - I'm not done. There is another reason to bring a date. I promise you:  she will not finish her food. Chances are your significant other will donate half her chicken to you. So, in essence, if you bring a date you get a half chicken instead of a quarter. Brilliant!

If you can't bring a date to a wholesome place like Pete's I guarantee you that you put a rock on that finger and the next thing you know and your ass will be sifting through tofu at Rainbow Grocery or picking up that box of organic  produce you now get delivered to your house.

For real though: this is a family joint and when the owner actually works there (as he has for many years) and tells me to have a nice day as I walk out it gives me that fuzzy wuzzy americana feeling. Go USA!

For those of you bitc*ing about lack of choice: what is wrong with you? That's like complaining to God about ONLY having blondes, brunettes and redheads. Would you question God, would you?

If meat is your god, Pete's BBQ is your sanctuary. 

Amen.
author: Carlos A.

description: Lacks taste.  I had a turkey sandwich and a side salad that was served floating in Italian dressing. Service was absolutely dead pan. It is impressive how much meat they seem to load into the front of the shop cooker for the day. I get that peeps live this place , it's just not for me.
author: M M.

description: Best turkey leg in San Francisco. Always makes me feel like I'm a viking when I eat here, which is a plus.
author: Kendall N.

description: My favorite place in the mission, always get the half chicken dinner with a baked patatoe and Mac salad
author: Edwardo P.

description: Do not pass this place up for its shabby looks - really good quality food. Get the chicken and ribs combo.
author: Apple P.

description:
I came in thinking that I would be at least somewhat disappointed because I probably had high expectations (usually eat at Phils BBQ in San Diego). Ordered the spare rib dinner, which comes with a baked potato with butter and bread (with butter), and added mac salad. 

I was not disappointed at all. The spare ribs, I would give a 4/5. Perfect texture and juiciness -- it didn't taste dry, overcooked, frozen and reheated, or too chewy. I was pleasantly surprised. The only thing it was missing was that nice charred/smokey flavor that you get from a bbq. 

The bread and potatoes were really good as well. THE BEST PART ABOUT THIS? My meal was only 10 dollars. I was really hungry, and I ended up eating only half of it (so technically, I got two satisfying meals!). 10 dollars got me three spare ribs (which were almost the size of a large beefy rib at most other places, which is pretty big still), a LOAD of macaroni salad, bread, and amazing baked potato.

I would come here again for sure.
author: Teresa T.

description:
I am not usually a fan of three bean salad...I've been back to Pete's BBQ twice now (yes of course for the bbq) BUT this place has by far, THE best, most flavorful three bean salad ever!! The perfect side for their 1/4 flavorful tangy, juicy bbq chicken with baked potato dinner.
Simple, tasty and same location for about...35 years! (Cash only)
author: Carmen M.

description: Oh my gooooooosh I am SO ENTHUSIASTIC about this place! Reasonable, beyond reasonable prices, big portions, juicy tender barbeque, satisfying sides, traditional feel, YES, A million times yes!
author: Taylor S.

description: Ok so we were over at the hospital and were hungry. Ended up here with my gf and her mom, let me tell you. It was delicious... To the point where I should've worn my elastic waist band pants-- & if we didn't have to go back to the hospital I would've ordered another plate of food. I'll be back and I'll tell everyone I know to go back as well.
author: Corinne W.

description:
*Awesome ribs
*Juicy rotisserie chicken
*Generous portions
*Yummy buttery baked potatoes
*Very affordable
*Ma and Pa non-pretentious atmosphere
I used to live around the corner from Pete's BBQ when I was a vegetarian and the smell made me want to gag but now as a meat eater I am making up for lost time...funny how we change but apparently Pete's hasn't changed much in all those years.
author: Monkey B.

description:
Wanted some bbq ribs.
went there, cost me 10$ for 1lbs a baked potato and a salad. Was not disapointed.
would recommend
author: Jonathan P.

description: Sooooo good. First time here. Definitely not my last. They were fast, delicious and affordable. I would recommend this place to my southern grandma. I got the chicken and rib combo. It was a lot of food for, I thought, a very fair price.
author: Matthew B.

description:
A no frills place with friendly employees and solid food. We ordered 2 dinners, which was more than enough food for two people - one half chicken and one spare ribs. They each came with a baked potato and side dish, as well as a piece of dutch crunch bread (slathered with way more butter than necessary). We had the pasta salad and the potato salad, which exceeded my (low) expectations. They're both pretty bland but not at all bad - I thought the pasta was pretty far overcooked but the potatoes were nicely cooked and cut into little chunks. 

But, that's not the reason you come here. Both types of meat were just excellently cooked. The chicken was succulent in all parts. The ribs were pretty fatty, but the meat itself was tender and tasty, especially on the crispy edges. The bbq sauce that can be slathered on everything was inoffensive but didn't add much. I liked my baked potato fine but wasn't as impressed with the drippings it had been roasted under as I expected to be.
author: Lisa K.

description:
This place is an abomination to all that is Que. Where should I start? 

Location: The Location is horrible. Located in the heart of the mission. The area is literally infested with  Five 0 pigs literally riding on the backs of vehicles like it's Rosarito in full battle rattle. Parking is an unfixed female dog. Forcing you to drop about 4 bucks an hour, that's literally 16 quarters. in my book thats Ricockulous. If you park make sure you park within an eye's reach of your vehicle. Broken windshield glass in broad day is no stranger in this part of town, and can easily be a welcome to your beamer if you roll 30k and up. People are hungry out here and will not hesitate to feed off the overprivileged. 

Presentation and Service: On the outside it look fine i guess. A building with the resturaunts name heading the top. A big window with food turning in a rotisserie. Strange for a que joint but whateves. I walk in.  Food looks disgusting, and the place is devilishly filthy. one of the options is literally , I kid you not, spaghetti with full sausages just laying right on top of the noodles. And the noodles looked like they were just swimming in that pool of red sauce. completely unappetizing.  The servers handle the food with complete lack of care. Hairy armed men, without gloves handle your meat and chop it up on a bent tin tray filled in a shallow pool of orange colored juice. It almost wanted to make me want to gag. But i stayed strong.. I'm trying a new place.. I swallow my foreign disgust, and try to see why yelp's panties are so damp for this place that they had to give it 4 stars. The line is long and I'm waiting to take my order... when i finally get through to order The dude reveals very unfriendly, in the thickest of thick eastern European accents that it's "KOSHUNLEY" (cash only). I'm like wtf?  
So you tellin me.. that in 2014, in one of the most populated and recognized cities in America, on one of the most broad and traffic filled streets you don't accept plastic? once again.. whatevs.. I walk out and go across the street to this shady looking western uniony-type of store with an ATM that had a 2 dollar fee to use. Back in line waiting again and this time store workers are moving in crates full of stuff from a back of a van to the catery trays.. at first i'm like.. what are they doing. And then I pay attention.. It's food. .. ALREADY COOKED FOOD. they're taking already cooked food and chopping it up on the serving trays and giving it to people! THEN WHERE THE CRAP IS THE FOOD COMING FROM!??!  Are they just buying food from Costco and reserving it to people? Does that mean the rotisserie is only for show? Is it even on? Once again...  i'm gagging in my mouth... and swallowing my comfort.. "i'm trying something new, I'm trying something new" By the time we get the food the place is full of locals and isn't very large. there is no place to sit. It's a shame that the there is no outside seating either. they definitely have the sidewalk space. 

Quality: I order for two, half a chicken and ribs. a baked potato and some bread.. the bread and the potato aren't part of a deal you have to pay more for them.. They have this weird option of adding butter, but they do it for you.. you can't add the butter yourself. and they don't even spread it in your bread, they just pop a butter square in the center of it. Stale to boot. The potato they put in a plastic tin. by the time you open it there is a little pool of melted butter swirling around under the potato, yellow as piss. The chicken taste like a flavorless, grocery store rotisserie chicken you can pick up for under ten bucks. nothing special. and they give it to you in a little heater bag instead of a more practical box or container. The ribs are horrible. bland, and very chewy. I've actually had better Safeway ribs. nothing is tender.. The sauce is horrible. ANYONE can make better sauce than this.. Heed this warning if you deceid to go to this place anyways.. DO NOT INGEST THE SAUCE. It makes everything worse. 

Overall: If you want cancer, trichinella spiralis, bird flu, or food poisoning to some degree I highly recommend this place. That being said this place is disgusting. there is nothing barbeque about this place.  avoid at all costs. 1 Star. oh. and I did a little research. Everyone that gives this place 5 stars generally gives everything they review 5 stars.. Like everything is the best that ever had.. check their profiles.. Just people five staring everything. This is a false positive.
author: Vinny T.

description:
For Yelpers who give high marks on the philosophy "I can't get over how much food I can get for so little money", might I suggest moving to Middle America where the buffets are plentiful and cheap!  For Yelpers who give high marks because of great childhood memories, might I remind them that children have horrible palates and prefer dishes like Kraft Mac & Cheese, Ellio's Pizza and Tyson Chicken Fingers.  I couldn't buy into the hype of Pete's, the food here is just ok.  A retro experience to remember, but nowhere near my top list of repeats in the Mission.

Rotisserie Chicken: Like most standard rotisserie chicken you'd find at supermarkets and restaurants.  The amazing differentiating factor is the warm BBQ sauce!  Love getting it on the side and dousing my tender chicken with it.  Not award winning, but leaps and bounds ahead of K.C. Masterpiece.  Comfort.

Ribs: Not a fan.  Very tough, like bad Chinatown spareribs.

Potato: The surprising star of this joint!  The bottom half of this tater is full of crunchy fatty delight.  I'm content just eating the skin and the surrounding 1/4 inch of baked potato.   I think they get this way be sitting below the rotating chickens when cooking to catch all the drippings.  The metallic bottom and the greasy drippings must then have a light slow fry reaction.  The top half is unremarkable though.

Spaghetti: Way softer than al dente.  The meat sauce reminded me of a school cafeteria.  Maybe a tad trailer, but decent when paired with the chicken.

Pasta Salad: Too soft pasta rounds in a mostly mayo sauce.  Spaghetti is a better choice.
author: Adam B.

description:
4.5 stars.

The food here is delicious.

Confession:  Before Pete's, I had never had ribs before, unless you count Morningstar's meat-less bbq ribs.  ...I didn't think so.

I had a rib craving the size of Texas for days and Yelp pointed me in the direction of Pete's Barbeque.  The reviews don't lie.

I got the quarter chicken and ribs combo to go.  Why to go?  Partially because they don't have a bathroom, and I would much rather prefer not to leave a sticky mess on my hands after my meal.  

I believe there were about 5 ribs.  The combo also came with your choice of salad and a baked potato.  They slather butter on your potato for you, so ask them not to if prefer to do it yourself.  For the salad, I chose macaroni.  The other two choices were cole slaw and potato salad.

The ribs were.. amazing.. but it was my first time so I don't really have anything to compare them to, but they were definitely better than meatless ribs!  I also didn't know they were going to be so fatty, but the fat can easily be removed.  The meat was very tender and slid off the bone.  Yumm.

I thought the chicken was even better than the ribs, although it was VERY close.  The flavor was just right, and it was EXTREMELY juicy.   If I were to come to Pete's again, I wouldn't be able to choose between the ribs and chicken combo, or just the chicken.

A baked potato is a baked potato, and the macaroni salad was okay.  But the sides aren't important in this case.

Yay for Pete's!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Had the yearning for good BBQ (I'm from the south), Pete's is a pretty good choice for the price. My advice is to ignore the sides, and go right for the meats. It doesn't make sense to judge a BBQ place on the sides. Based on my own advice, I'm giving it 5 stars for the delectable quarter chicken I had (with sauce!), and ignoring the mediocre bean salad.

Next time I go, I think it's going to be takeout for a pound of ribs and a roasted potato. You can see the meat and potatoes all turning on spits in the same oven, so I bet that the potatoes come out infused with delicious roast chicken flavor.
author: Andrew W.

description: Worst BBQ ever.  Ribs were greasy, fatty tissue, very unappetizing.  BBQ sauce a watery tomato based something, totally non-BBQ taste.  Ironically I had just had BBQ last week in Pacifica at Gorilla BBQ, a wonderful experience.
author: Larry M.

description:
This is one of those places that I will never forget. My grandfather used to take me to Pete's BBQ for dinner with the family growing up. He loved the whole "blue plate special" and slow roasted meats. I've also learned to love these things as well.

The place hasn't really changed since. The food is still delicious and the portions are hearty. My favorite dinner includes a 1/4 Rotisserie Chicken (All Breast), Baked Potato with BBQ sauce all on it, the Cucumber Salad or 3 Bean Salad served with a giant roll and butter baby. 

It's classics like this place that keep me coming back for more and where good food is always memorable.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
I love me some BBQ. I have sampled the BBQ in Kansas City, Memphis, ATL and Texas, etc... I know good BBQ and am thrilled to find this little gem right in my own neighborhood!   I have passed by Pete's dozens of times, but today, the ribs were calling. I ordered a pound of ribs for $8. Nothing more and nothing less. I was  accommodating when the server apologized that it was a little over a pound. No problem, I can handle that. Sauce? Yes, please. The rest of the offerings looked good, I'm told the chicken is excellent, but this trip was just abut the ribs. 
I made it home and was delighted with the moist, tender, meaty ribs. I can understand the comments about the sauce, but it is not bad at all. It is very mild, but very good nonetheless. Add a little cayenne if you want a kick. Reviews that say Pete's is not BBQ, don't know what BBQ is- regional. BBQ is different, the sauce is different depending on which part of the country. By that logic, a Memphis dude could say that Texas grills good meat but its not BBQ. Yeah, whatever, the ribs were so good, who cares?  I'd be proud to call Pete's SF Style BBQ! 
I am so happy I stopped in today and will definitely be back to try the other offerings. If everything else is as good, I may even upgrade to 5 stars!
author: Yolanda I.

description: I'm so lucky...or unlucky depending on how fat I get...that I get to walk by Pete's everyday going home from work. The intoxicating smell of the ribs and chicken drenched in their homemade bbq sauce would make anyone salivate. The combo deal for a little over 11 bucks is way more food then you should be able to eat. 2 slabs of ribs, 1/4 chicken, potato, and salad should satisfy anyone. Sometimes I come here when I just need someting to gnaw on as I walk home. It gets dirty with their sauce but who cares when you're holding a piece of chicken walking down Van Ness. The only thing I don't really like from here is the spaghetti since it is a little watery and the potatos. The potato is my own issue since I'm not a big fan already and then I see them slab on the butter and I just want feel my heart stop.
author: Nam T.

description: The meat here is all very moist and tender. It feels almost like they steamed everything. This makes for a wonderfully moist chicken, but the ribs lack any texture or bite. The BBQ sauce makes or breaks a Q joint and it's very bland here... almost like the sweet liquid you get in BBQ beans at BBQ joints. It IS a good deal though for how much food you get for the money.
author: John H.

description: Like the other reviewers have mentioned, the chicken here is awesome. Ordered a quarter chicken for like $2 and it was amazing. Didn't really need the BBQ sauce. So delish. If I'm in this area again and don't feel like spending an arm and a leg at one of the popular restaurants, this is my place.
author: K C.

description:
I went here on a whim, hoping it would have some Pastrami, but they don't have it. They have: Chicken, ham, turkey and ribs. I opted for the quarter chicken special which comes with a massive baked potato and your choice of salad, plus a roll.

The food was ok, but not amazing. For $7 you do get a decent amount of food, and I only ate half the potato and the salad, but all the chicken. 

I might come back to try the ribs, but overall a pretty neutral rating.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Loves me some Pete's!

The large rotisserie they have in the front window reminds me of being a kid outside of Sam's Hofbrau watching the turkey and beef slowly turning on the spit, my mouth watering in delight. Mmmmmmm

They cook everything fresh Turkey, Roast Beef, Potatoes, Ribs and Chicken. Watching it go 'round and 'round, the ribs basting the chicken, basting the potatoes, basting the ribs.... By the time they rotate to the top everything has this nice glaze of brownness that is what makes everything taste so wonderful. And you can smell it from blocks away. I'm fortunate to work down-wind and I'm absolutely, absolutely forced to eat here on a regular basis. It's a tough job but someone has to do it.

Besides the delectable meats they have fresh chopped salad, potato salad, macaroni salad and their own-made pickled beets. Yum. And their sandwiches are enormous, generous with all the fixins, meats cooked fresh daily and sliced fresh right in front of you like an old fashioned Hofbrau. You can actually see what's going into your sandwich. Make sure to ask for the cuts you like, crispy end bits, med-rare, well done, etc.

Did I mention that everything is surprisingly affordable?

I just can't enough about this place, including their staff - a genuinely nice bunch of folks. 

Enjoy!
author: Travin T.

description:
After walking around the Mission for a while looking for somewhere to eat that 1) seemed delicious, 2) wasn't totally packed and 3) wasn't overpriced, I ended up at Pete's 5 minutes before close. Technically I found this gem 15 minutes before close, but, as usual, I failed to have cash and had to hit up a nearby ATM. 

The portions were enormous. $7 will get you a barbeque chicken breast, very tasty salad (I had the bean salad, but there was also potato, pasta, something resembling Caprese and a few other choices), a baked potato and a hunk of bread. Awesome! Unfortunately, they close at 8, but if you're late (like me), you can take your scrumptious meal down the street a little park off mission and chow down there. 

 I'd highly recommend this place; I'm always torn when I see a place with no atmosphere. It seems a toss up as to whether they survived by being excellent or are playing off your assumption that they must have survived by being excellent. In this case, it's definitely the former!
author: Melissa F.

description: I love Pete's barbecue I've been going their since i was 5yrs old, now that i have my kids i take them their..We drive 45 minutes just to eat barbecue is that crazy or what but pete's bbq is screaming with flavor and you have fun their it's a small place but it's so full with pete's energy...I don't think im gonna ever stop going their
author: Evelyn-Juan C.

description: Best turkey sandwich I've ever had.  I'm not a huge meat eater but there is just something that they do the turkey to make it taste so good! It's such a simple no-frills place but you can feel the history in the walls.  There is a reason this place has been around so long! Highly recommend this place for all the bbq fanatics out there.
author: Alia P.

description: Visited the mission last Saturday and parked right across Pete's bbq. My wife and I walked in, ordered the spare ribs and salad and enjoyed the meal. You want good old bbq, go to Pete's. You pay for the food not for the ambiance.
author: WM D.

description: I go for the combo roast beef/turkey sandwich. Best item on the menu.
author: Brian H.

description: Born and raised in the south and know good BBQ and this is GOOD BBQ. Hubby brought home a whole chicken with their sauce and it was amazing! Not too sweet, not too thick. Just a great sauce. We will definitely be back.
author: Jaimie C.

description: Barbecue?! There's nothing barbecue about this place besides the sauce they put on the rotisserie meats. Ribs were tough and overly salted. Barbecue sauce had no flavor. I don't understand how they designate themselves as a barbecue place...or how so many people have rated them so highly. I have to give them credit for tasty coleslaw and baked potatoes. For the ribs, 0 stars.
author: Kevin-louis B.

description:
I tried another sandwich, this time Ham. They slice the ham freshly right off of the bone for you.

The sandwich could have used a little mustard but that my fault for not asking.

It's a very hearty sandwich, with a couple sides this would be enough for two people.

If you want a good sandwich or a tasty rotisserie chicken served to you by a gruff old Greek guy this is the place for you.
author: Manny F.

description: Great food here with a kind smile.  The quarter chicken meal for 8 bucks.  Can't beat it.  It's a lot of good food.  This is a serious bargain and the place is historic.  Check it out.
author: Zach H.

description:
Cheap.  Smells amazing.  Not so tasty.  

I stopped by here as I was walking by for a side to accompany dinner.  I ordered a pint of the spaghetti, but the bbq smelled so good that I had to order some ribs too.  I took them home, excited to taste them.

When I pulled the ribs out of their bag, I was very disappointed to see that there wasn't very much meat on them at all.  My disappointment grew as I took a bite and was unimpressed.  Very plain.  Sadly, the spaghetti wasn't any better.  I don't understand how, but the spaghetti had an APPLE PIE flavor to it.  Wth??

Maybe I screwed up not getting chicken or something, but the ribs and spaghetti were no bueno.  I wonder how this place has been here for so long.  I guess the low prices go a long way.  

I probably wont find myself in the neighborhood again any time soon, but if I do, I will definitely try and find someplace else nearby to eat.
author: Jon B.

description: Love this place! Old school take out type of restaurant. Yummy chicken and authentic sauce. Great place to get a chicken and baked potato to go and eat it at home.
author: Vas P.

description:
Pete's Barbecue is a bit of a misnomer for me.  I think of it as more of a neighborhood hof brau with savory roasted meats and cold salad sides.  They cook everything: rotisserie chicken, ribs, brisket, turkey. And they have a side salad for whatever you are craving: beet, macaroni, green, or garbanzo salad. 

My friend and I enjoy trekking out here and splitting the 1/2 chicken dinner plate. It's a great value. You get: 1/2 rotisserie chicken (choice of bbq sauce), baked potato loaded with butter and sour cream, a choice of side salad, and a bread roll.

Sounds simple, but it's deceptively delicious! The chicken is rotisserie perfection. You are TRIPPIN' if you think Pete's chicken tastes like Costco rotisserie chicken. The meat is tender, juicy, flavorful and the skin is lightly crisp. The chicken is so flavorful that the bbq sauce is unnecessary. The beet salad is tangy, sweet, and a refreshing compliment to the chicken and baked potato.  My friend really enjoys her macaroni salad. And before I forget, let me sing the praises of this bread roll. It is sweet roll perfection goodness! 

Pete's is a great option for me in the Mission when I can't get over to my favorite hof brau: Tommy's Joynt.
author: Monelle A.

description:
I was sure there was a place where you could eat cheap good food in San Francisco...
The atmosphere and the way the plates look might not meet your expectations BUT this is the best value for money place I managed to find the last 2 months I have been in SF. ( any suggestion welcome)
It is a Greek style barbeque place, the owner is Greek and Greeks don't play with food!
author: Antony T.

description: Felt like I was sitting at my grandma's table eat a homemade meat & 3. Lots of good, fresh meat options. Quick service, but not a lot of seating.
author: Kyle K.

description: love this place!! i've been a loyal customer since i was 6 y/o 18 years now!! love it! my daughter loves it too!!!
author: Gabi A.

description:
Finding good bbq in San Francisco can be rough. Sure you can find a stand out item or two around the city (Sneaky's does a mean pulled pork and Memphis Minnie's has amazing brisket), but it's hard to find a really solid bbq joint. So I'm always on the look out for bbq ... I know there has to be an amazing place in SF. I just know it!

I recently moved to the Mission and saw this place on my way home.  It didn't look very new or clean, but after checking Yelp and it's great reviews I decided to try it out.

The staff wasn't very friendly when I walked in.  There were no smiles or greetings, they just got to the point and asked me what I wanted (they weren't very busy btw). I ordered ribs, chicken, and a baked potato with bbq sauce ($9) to go and promptly left.

FOOD: The chicken was moist and very tasty (although the skin wasn't crispy like the other Yelpers mentioned), but the bbq sauce was lackluster and watery.  It was a little disappointing. Even if you have perfectly cooked meat, the bbq won't be great unless your sauce is awesome. The ribs were ok ... once you pried them from the bones.  In my opinion, the meat on bone in ribs needs to slide right off.  That's what makes a well cooked rib.

*sigh* I guess the quest for a great bbq joint continues ...
author: Lara O.

description: After reading all the great reviews, I was a little disappointed in the food. It wasn't bad, just not the great bbq I was expecting. I got the half chicken and ribs combo with potato salad and slaw. The ribs didn't have a whole lot of meat, the chicken was slightly dry and the bbq sauce just wasn't that good. I would definitely try this place again because maybe they just had an off day.
author: Chad T.

description: Maybe it was just the one time I went, but it was honestly one of the worst meals I've had in San Francisco (the other was Tad's Steaks on Powell). The chicken was so dry and bristly it was almost inedible. The sides were straight up sustenance, and nothing else. I didn't finish my meal.
author: Soysizzle t.

description:
I have been coming here since I was a kid.  Best turkey sandwich in the world.  

Sliced turkey, juice on the bread with a bit of turkey skin to top.  Finishing the sandwich is a feat.  

Pete is a god!
author: Peter L.

description: We were walking by and the delicious smell coming from this place made us go in. Lots of good comfort bbq food for the price. The sauce was perfect, and we liked the buttery baked potatoes. Service was friendly enough. The salads were alright, nothing special, maybe instead of the salad get another baked potato? We will for sure be coming back.
author: John T.

description:
Whoever gives this a 5 star review is on crack...  

First...  You can't call yourself a BBQ place, just because you have a thin, super salty sauce, that slightly resembles bbq sauce... And you put it on meat...

Personally, I think all BBQ should be smoked as a pre-req, but this place does everything in a rotisserie...  It is a rotisserie chicken place, that has a red sauce you can choose to cover it in, and they also sell rotisserie ribs with the same option...

Chicken was good and juicy
Ribs were dry, chewy, and downright crisp in spots
Sides were... uh... cafeteria lunch style sides
Sauce... SOOO Salty, no real flavor...

THIS IS NOT BAR-B-QUE.... I repeat... THIS IS NOT BBQ.  Period.
author: Will W.

description:
Okay, in all fairness, I was completely STARVING when I went here. My brain kept flashing meat before my eyes, so what better place to find good meat than at a bbq joint, right? 

That being said, I'm probably rating this place a little high, just because I was happy to have some sort of food in my mouth. 

The Atmosphere: nonexistent. I think they keep the "atmosphere" places over on Valencia. This is the corner of 20th and Mission, you're going to get drug deals, sirens and bum fights. This is the street corner where I nearly took out a homeless man with my car as he was stumbling across the street while shaving his face with a disposable Bic. 

Anyways, this place is a mom-and-pop operation on the corner with dingy pail yellow walls, about five tables and a counter with three stools. In lieu of music, there's a REALLY loud fan blowing from somewhere in the back.

The Service: The people were nice enough, service was fairly prompt. It's all counter service, no waitstaff. 

The Food: I ordered the Combo plate which gets you about 3-4 decent sized ribs and 1/4 of a chicken (breast meat). With the dinner, you get a baked potato slathered with butter (AWESOME), a choice of about four different sides and an enormous dinner roll with butter in it. You can have your meat with or without bbq sauce, I opted for sauce. The ribs were a little cold but still good, and the chicken was VERY tender. The sauce didn't really "wow" me though. 

For $12, I walked out full and satisfied. They even acknowledged my exiting the place. They really need to offer some wet naps or something though.
author: Eyva Kid C.

description:
Where did this place come from - big portions and lots of meat. It reminds me of stories my parents told me about.... Nice selection of meat and sides and BBQ sauce. 
I found this place last week, but probably drove by it so many times. It was a great to go get food and bring it home place. It is felt lost within a changed community, but the place has a following. The man behind the counter seemed to know at least half of the people coming in. I give it a qualified 4.
author: Maki T.

description: This is some large quantity BBQ at a low price.  The flavors are all mild, if you like spicy or spiced, this isn't the place for you.  But if you want a large amount of protein and carbs with minimal expenditure, head on down to Pete's!
author: Joel Z.

description:
I went to Pete's on the suggestion of a coworker who indicated that it was "pretty alright." Apparently if you're from Lebanon, but raised in Ohio, "pretty alright" means "good enough to choke down, but not bad enough to make you vomit."

Pete's is deceptive. When you first walk in you are greeted with a delicious looking display of baked potatoes and meats, which tugs at your inner soul. Then you move down the line, 8th grade cafeteria style and tell the nice men in orange shirts (similar to county lock up gear, or hip hop clothing) what you want. They offer spaghetti here, and I went with that and some sausage. With a potato for good measure.

The portions are hefty, and at $7.25 I was filled to the top with a lot left over. Part of that was my stomach, and another part was the food itself. Greasy and slightly undercooked, my spaghetti was about 3rd grade science project level.
