The potato was sitting in a little pool of butter when I got it back to my office; this place is diabetes waiting to happen.
author: Wes T.

description: This place is NOT...I repeat...NOT a BBQ joint. However, Pete's BBQ does smell delicious wafting down the street. The side dishes at this place are not the best. Very watery. The spaghetti seems as if it was out of a boyardee can. The chicken is nice and tender and I will say the spit roasted potato is delicious. Hence the 2 star rating. For the people who gave this place anything over 3 stars...are you on crack? Texas and Memphis BBQ...REAL BBQ put this place to shame...If you want to get actual BBQ...go to Baby Blues down the road on Mission Street.
author: Mr. Potato G.

description:
Needed some food for a party. Went in and got only the ribs. Had to wait about 5 minutes for them to come out of the oven. WOW they were good! I mean delicious, The sauce was amazing. Not too sweet, not too much like Ketchup. Really AMAZING can't wait to go back. The no frill atmosphere just makes me like it more!

Highly recommend!
author: Lisa C.

description: What can I say! Pete's never fails me. My personal favorite are the filling sandwiches they have to offer! Turkey and Roast Beef are to die for! Really good, affordable, and a complete meal! The ribs and chickens are really good and the sides they have to offer make it a feast! I recommend Pete's to anyone who wants some good quick BBQ in S.F. It's family ran and owned and Pete himself is always hard at work! Always humble and great customer service. I'll keep coming back to this spot.
author: J M.

description:
I would have to agree with most of the folks here regarding the rotisserie chicken.  It's pretty damn good - the skin and seasons are crisp and tasty.  Not too salty and cooked to near perfection.  I give it the edge over George's BBQ down the street however neither one of them are that much better than the birds at Portico.  I'm not nuts about their BBQ (hot?) sauce but really I'm fine with just a little Crystal hot sauce.

I've yet to have any other meats here but after reading the reviews it sounds like they are mostly sub-par.  Maybe you'd be better off heading over to Baby Blues, Memphis Minnie's or George's BBQ for that.  And I've had enough quality roadside BBQ in Texas to know that it's not so easy to make a killer brisket, BBQ pulled pork, baby back ribs (try the Galley) and hot links.

Maybe they should consider changing the name to Pete's Rotisserie Chicken?
author: Bradford K.

description:
the food is not really bbq'd - it's kind of rotisserie baked, then a man chops it with garden shears, throws it into a pile of other animal parts to then be painted with layer of bbq sauce with an industrial sized paintbrush.

it's really cheap for basic baked chicken to go, but i wouldn't hang out, and i probably won't go back.
author: Amanda F.

description:
Pete, Pete, Pete... I've been eating your chicken for years. I guess it's about time I let you know what I really think... 

DAMN GOOD CHICKEN AND RIBS! 

I don't have time to argue if it's 'rotisserie' or 'BBQ'. The meat falls right off the bone. It's just plain GOOD. 

The BBQ sauce works well with everything on the menu and the baked potatoes are HUGE! 

Really, Pete? Did you tweak the vents to purposely gush all these yummy smells onto the street to lure customers in? Well guess what? It works!!!!
author: PukaShell s.

description: The varied reviews are really amazing.  I do not know if I should try this place or not.  I know it is all about taste, but reading these reviews makes me wonder if everyone went to the same place.
author: Dinah R.

description: This place is comfort food at its finest.  My family has been going here longer than I've been alive.  Its simple, rotisserie goodness that hits the spot every time.  Chicken is always tasty and moist and I love to slather the homemade BBQ sauce on my potato or macaroni salad (hella good).  Ribs are really good and we always grab a chicken to go for the next day.  Simple, family owned and the owners are super nice.   I leave behind a clean plate every time.
author: Rosemary A.

description:
I walked to this area from Union Square specifically to eat some good Mexican food, which is abundant here. But I was sucked in by the "Petes BBQ" sign.

The counter staff were all patient as I tried to understand my options.

No pulled pork, mmmm. Okay, I saw the ribs in the rotisserie, not doing it. The chicken looked like it might have a nice crunchy skin, let's go with that. Oh, you get two sides with the 1/2 chicken meal. Got two bowls big enough for three people. Good, solid coleslaw and a three bean salad type.

Someone left a table and it was just being cleaned off; I nabbed it. Couple minutes later a guy asked if he could sit with me. Sure, sit down. I would have liked to discuss his meal with him, seemed like a regular that knew everyone, but my skills outside of English are extremely limited. He also recognized my lack of understanding and we just smiled at each other for the rest of the meal.

He had to work to get the meat off his ribs. My chicken on the other hand was cooked, not fall off the bone cooked, just short of that. The sauce added a little something, but mostly salt.

So, now I haven't really had good BBQ in SF and I'm still looking for my missed Mexican meal.
author: Jon L.

description:
The prices are good and the special is great. I got a plate of ribs, chicken, a side, plus a baked potato for less than $11. Don't get the special, the chicken is subpar. 

That's pretty impressive. The ribs were good though, the sauce was decent though it could use some more spice. They close too early and they are cash only which is the reason they get 3 stars. Sorry, take a credit card damn't and stay up later. Honestly, I woud come here more if I wanted two meals worth of food.
author: Rohan D.

description:
I love ribs.  I adore ribs.  These are the best ribs I've had in the city.  They are large, meaty, and have a nice covering of fat on the ends.  Dinner comes with three of them and they are plenty big enough.  Oh, man, they were good.

There were downsides to the restaurant, but I don't care, I love ribs.  They had to microwave my food (that seemed a bit odd), people behind the counter were surly, and don't have fountain soda or refills on ice tea.  They are cash only, and close at 8pm on Sunday.  But, who cares?  THE RIBS WERE AMAZING.

Mmm.  Ribs.
author: Dee B.

description: They have great customer service great bbq sauce the smell is just GREAT. You can't go wrong with this bbq place
author: Reyanna L.

description: OK so some say this is not BBQ, and I can see how they come to that conclusion. They don't use smoke, wood or coals. If one was to be more precise they are Rotisserie joint that is really good! The Rib dinner is on hit and still under 10 bucks. The chicken is also very tasty. And the sauce (that's what the old man calls it) has a spice to it that is all its own, and the potato basting in the chicken dripping is a must have. I still feel like it is a treat going here, and I have been going for about 20 years.
author: Debra R.

description: Amazing food.  Delicious food all homemade "sauces" and salads.  Personally, I think the lack of atmosphere creates a pretty cool atmosphere.  But that's just me.  Great prices and window seats!  I don't normally like baked potatoes because to me they just lack a little flavor by themselves.  These potatoes had a very savory flavor due to the fact they are cooked roasted in with chickens and such.  I didn't try the spaghetti, I wish I had given the review on it.
author: Lenette P.

description: I keep seeing this place in my hood.  Wonder in just now.  Go home with a half chicken and a rib in bag.  Chewing.  Phone rings, another call, and another call.   Sorry folks I cant answer your call. I am too busy licking my paws.  Chicken is super moist.  Albeit oily and greasy- its freakin goood.  Rib was same .  Sauce for me is on the side.  You gotta dip before you dip then DIP DIP DIP.   note:  this aint everett jones or flints.  this is not smoked etc.
author: Rob C.

description: I was turned on to Pete's back in March of 2014. I was told to get the turkey sandwich and was told to order it a certain way. I have to say it was the best fresh rotisserie roasted turkey that I have ever had. They use the freshest rolls and produce in their finished product. I have gone back many, many times and have ventured to try what they claim to have BBQ. I must say it's really good for what it is. It's not the traditional BBQ but done on the rotisserie...everything is done on the rotisserie and the juices flow from one meat down to the next, even the potatoes. I can't say that I have never tried anything that wasn't good.  Even the wife who's  a very picky eater likes the roast beef. Plus met the owner "Pete " and he's a very nice guy.  Once I didn't have enough cash since this place is cash only Pete told me to just pay him back next time I came in...who still does that? Needless to say I have done that and will continue to show my support of this awesome place. It's not much from the outside or even the inside but I must say the people are really nice and I have never had anything bad.  I would say try a turkey sandwich with everything or how to order it is to ask for white, dark meat and a little bit of skin plus have the roll dipped in the juice plus have the lettuce and tomato on it with a little bit of mayo it is the best!
author: Alex M.

description:
I just love Pete's. And not only because it's a 5 minute walk from my house. (Although that helps.) But it's that smell.  I can't walk by it without buying a chicken! Mmm that smell. They pipe it into the street to getcha!

It definitely seems like a family business, of which I approve. The ambiance of full-on regulars is great, too. Everyone likes a business with a line out the door! (It moves pretty fast, except for when I've got 3 bottles of wine and friends waiting for me at Dolores Park, but I pretend it's just b/c the cute weekend guy wants to check me out. Ha.)  

Chicken: The skin is tasty, sticky-like-i-like-it, and flavorful. The dark meat is moist, and the breasts are plump. (Like mine.) (Well, kinda.) (Or not.) (Anyway.)

Moving on... I also love that you can get a full-on turkey neck for $1. Yum.

I LOVE the ribs, but they are hella salty, so be warned.

5 stars for my tasty local chicken joint.
author: Dina G.

description:
This place is just bomb man i love it and it gives a great view of what goes down in the mission like bums fighting and drug dealing its like a free movie haha love it! parking is kind of hard to get ive got lucky almost all the time. the food is just BOMB i love it the ribs just perfect not too salty and the spaghetti makes it so much better with the side of bread and butter ule feel very full when your done. 

waay better than gorilla BBQ in pacifica that place sucked 
anyways the place is def worth going too and 9/10 times ule love it the staff is just neutral but not mean other than that head to Petes BBQ ule love it!!!!
author: Isaac R.

description:
This place is the mack. 
Highlights of my visit:
Generous portions of the bomb macaroni salad 
Chicken sausage
Mellow evening vibe
author: roby s.

description: I really wanted to like this place but the food here is pretty disgusting.  I'm fat.  I eat a lot of BBQ.  Nothing here is BBQed.  Its all roasted on a rotisserie or in the oven.  The only thing that makes this BBQ is their nasty ass sauce.  I'd rather eat Baby Rays from target.  The food here is cafeteria style and served on cafeteria style plates.  When I was able to squeeze my fat ass in the door I wanted to turn around and leave but I couldn't fit my fat ass through the door.  So I said fuck it I need to try this food.  I should have just sucked it in and left.  The only good thing was the baked potato.  Everything else was gross.
author: Fatty A.

description: Both the chicken and ribs are very tender and tasty, but if I had to pick, I'd go for the ribs - I can make chicken more easily at home! I've had it where the sauce was too sweet, but it wasn't this last time that I went. I still get the sauce on the side just in case. I also tried the spaghetti which is kind of like Chef Boyardi, but seems to work with the ribs! I also have a weakness for the macaroni salad. Pasta and mayonnaise shouldn't be edible, but my southern roots trump my sensibilities. Can't go wrong with the baked potato, too. Add you own butter (not margarine) when you get home.
author: Tu T.

description: Yummy yummy! The food was excellent, though there isn't much to choose from. I especially like their spaghetti and the ribs are great. The moment you walk in you will salivate at all the tasty looking meats they have laying around. It might be hard to find seating here because all the tables are quick to be occupied. Another bad thing is they don't have a restroom, which is.... not cool.
author: Wayne P.

description: Excellent! I had Mac salad with combo, friend had 3 bean salad with combo. We both enjoyed our meals. Courteous staff, family run.  Eye candy present as well
author: T G.

description: Petes BBQ has never failed me. i have been coming here for years and til this continue to do so.
author: Silvia R.

description:
Went here for a late Thursday lunch on a whim. The whole place and set up is a trip being that its in the Mission. Right outside there's a bunch of old-schools jus chillin, hanging and choppin it up. You can tell its their spot as everyone walks around them and half of everyone says "what up".

As soon as you walk in, there's the rotisserie and broiler. Chickens, porks and beefs is spinnin and rotatin and makin themselves look yummy. We got the whole bbq chicken, a turkey sandwich and the pork rib dinner plate with macaroni salad and bread. The owner, maybe Pete(?), was the one carving up all the meats for us and it felt like he gave us more than we had bargained for. Its not the best bbq i've ever had but you can taste the love in the food.

I like eating and people watching along the busy corner. You can almost, always count on a basehead or junkie to pass by and sell something to someone on the corner. That coupled with the food here quickly passed up 2 hours of my time like nothing.
author: Nick V.

description:
once in a while, i come home and there a few bags of ribs on the kitchen counter, still warm. its like christmas morning to me. i have never been to pets but throughout my childhood, my parents will come home with a few white bags full of juicy fatty goodness (and some okay tater salad) and i get to be in heaven for a few minutes while i devour them.
FAVE RIBS hands down. 
get them. they do not disappoint.
the bbq chicken is good i suppose, but I'm not a huge bbq chicken fan so i wouldn't know.
author: Jess C.

description:
Ahh Petes.  What can I say?  Not really BBQ.  

I got the Chicken n Rib combo, so let me break it down for you guys.

Chicken:   It's rotisserie.  It was actually really juicy and really good, but it's not what I expect from a BBQ joint.

Ribs:  Did not fall off the bone.  Seemed broiled.

Potato Salad:  Decent flavors.

Baked Potato:   A little dry.  Served with butter.

Side order- 

Beet Salad:  Beets in  some sort of vinaigrette dressing.  I presonally love beets so this may not be for you.

Overall a reasonably priced meal.  Don't come here if you're specifically looking for BBQ.  Come here if you're in the neighborhood and looking for a good meal.

Highlight: Dudes shootin' dice outside on a Saturday afternoon.
author: El T.

description:
you want a large quantity of relatively bland yet somehow still grubbin' food on the cheap? pete's will answer your needs.

i did it just to say i did, but not sure if i'll do it again.
author: Ameer N.

description: Not sure how this came up as top rated for BBQ on the Yelp mobile client.  I gave it a try and was not impressed.  This is not in my opinion BBQ but meat with BBQ sauce on top of it.  Ribs are overly salty, not smoked or grilled.  Chicken was good but I'd likely pass on the BBQ sauce if I went back which I won't be doing.  Would not recommend :(
author: Bryan M.

description:
Turkey dinner was $9.30.No mashed potatoes available,only baked!
No gravy, only juice.Comes with a salad(I got macaroni)and a decent sized bread with butter inside.The barely adequate amount of turkey was cold and dry,I asked them to nuke it.With a can of coke it came to $11.30.
Not acceptable.
Next.
author: Mag N.

description: This place serves delicious BBQ ribs, rotisserie chicken, and baked potatoes. The BBQ ribs are cooked in a rotisserie oven, hence they are always juicy, moist, and tender. The meat literally fall off the bone. The BBQ sauce is OK, it is not spicy or sweet. It is not very strong and does not cover up the taste of the meat. The chicken is also good. The meat is moist, tender, and flavorful. Normally, they cover the chicken in BBQ sauce, which makes it taste better. Their baked potato is the best. It is baked in the rotisserie oven along with the other meat, it is covered with drippings (lard) from the ribs and chicken. It is moist, warm , soft, and baked thoroughly. Moreover, the oil covered potato skin is delicious. The spaghetti and sausages are mediocre and I would stay away from it. I have been coming to this place on and off for years.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: Decent little BBQ joint.. The food isn't amazingly tasty, but I will say it's definitely worth  the trip. The costs is extremely low as well.. I liked their ribs and chicken breast. I think we ended up spending a whopping 12 dollars for half a chicken and half a rack of ribs, so yeah.. the price is definitely affordable.
author: Terry B.

description: Just wasn't all that good. Heard good things, definitely had better. The options for sides are well sloppy. I've had hole in the wall but this was just lousy.
author: Cove C.

description: Hm.. I wanted to rate it higher because i love the mission but why is everything so salty??? Ribs chicken spaghetti, overload of sodium..it was cooked right, sauce a bit off.
author: Tiff W.

description:
I work across the street from this place and the smell is always intoxicating. They have great rotisserie chicken at a good price, but my favorite is their turkey offal. It's kind of a fricassee of livers, gizzards, hearts and necks in a brown gravy and it's *delicious*. Sometimes I stop by and just get that for a meaty snack. In fact, I think I'll do it today.

I also love the unremodeled old school diner atmosphere here. The only bummer is the margarine they lavish on the potatoes and rolls. If it were real butter I'd be 100% in love.
author: maggie g.

description:
On a semi sunny Sunday afternoon my dearest roommate, his longstanding Internet flame (not really), her much more interesting friend, and a girl I once, many months ago, met on Craigslist, and I went to Pete's BBQ.  The roomie and I had previously walked by it quite a few times, but this Sunday was the day.  The day I would eat some ribs, their juicy juices dribbling down my chin and not getting into my facial hair as I had just shaved...  The day I would gnaw some rotisserie chicken bones... The day I would devour a baked potato the size of a blimp.  

It was that day.  True to my dreams, I ordered the ribs, got a blimp sized potato, and convinced my friend to order the chicken so I could gnaw the bones.  The flame's friend got the Turkey, which also seemed like a solid choice just from the looks of it.  As there was no free seating inside, we dragged everything to Dolores park, where in true hipster fashion we proceeded to eat.    

My ribs were tasty.  They were juicy, meaty, and the bbq sauce did not overpower their flavor, as sometimes can happen.  If I had just eaten the ribs the place would have gotten a four stars.  My blimp size potato, contrary to its adjective, was actually not full of air, but rather, was solid and filling, crispy and soft in all the right places.  Unfortunately, that was where the tastiness ended.  The rotisserie chicken tasted much like its Costco counterpart, which, my grandpas adoration aside, is just not that good.  The Turkey was even worse, ending up being super dry despite the sauce it was liberally covered with. 

So, in conclusion, the ribs were yummie, and everything else is skippable.  If Yelp had a 3.5 star option this would get it, but failing that, 3 stars it is.
author: Leon K.

description:
I think Yelp should consider enabling half-a-star rating. 
For me Pete's is a 3.5 Stars. 
It would have been 4 stars if the chicken they serve is pippin' hot, but.....
I ordered a quarter chicken thigh and they were lukewarm and borderline cold. They were still delicious though! But it's just... cold. I like my BBQ HOT! 

Other than that, it's a little place, and you can see them grilling their chicken in the restaurant. Everything else was alright. You get a salad side (I got the beet salad! YUMM) Also, they give you bread with butter.

All in all, it was a lot of food for $7.00ish.
author: Miss C.

description:
This place is funny.
The workers here look HILARIOUS in their orange prisonesque jumpsuits.  However, they were all pretty kind.
I was overwhelmed by the mad rush of people so I ordered a Polish sausage sandwich.  It was damn tasty but not worth the $$$.
GET THE BAKED POTATO!  They have them nestled underneath the roasting chickens, so THEY'RE BAKED POTATOES MARINATED IN CHICKEN FAT, SLATHERED IN BUTTER AND SOUR CREAM!
Heaven.  
Carb heaven.
Other than the orange jumpsuits and the potatoes, there's no reason to really come here.
author: Meh M.

description:
After driving by Pete's for years & never stopping in, I finlly decided to give it a try. I loved the ribs. They were a great combination tender & crispy along the edges. Made it into a "dinner" with a really well-done baked potato & a salad of my choice, plus a roll - all for $10 incl tax. 

Really enjoyed the sauce (optional) and had enough for leftovers for another meal.
author: judah m.

description: BBQ on a budget.  Nice staff---rotisserie BBQ and watching the OG's gamble outside the window---CLASSIC ONLY IN THE MISSION!
author: Ty A.

description:
Labelled as a barbeque joint but its really more of a carvery diner hole-in-the wall that happens to serve ribs along with rotisserie chicken, sausages, and a few other entrees with baked potato and salad (macaroni, slaw or green). 

Ribs were decently cooked but didn't fall off the bone. I couldn't tell if there was any rub spice flavor to the meat and the barbeque sauce was bland.

I don't mean to dis them, just give folks a heads up that its not really a BBQ joint per se. The chicken looked great and its oozing with sincere family-owned dive diner ambience.
author: David P.

description:
geeezzz louise, why would anyone like going there?! 

Mmm... great tasty food, and just that type of place, so neighborhood, so down to earth, great staff and traditional.  Definitely 1of the best in its class.

Obiviously i LUV all the meats offer and nice pricing.  What do i gravitate toward other than there delish meats? Just luv their veggie side dishes by the TUBS,...hehehe, just kidding, lot of'm please, and yes 2go. If ya got sum time and want to treasure sum neighborhood scenery i'd stay a little while.
author: LindaLu N.

description:
Cheap. Good Portions. Hot. Good.

4 things about Pete's that's true. I love eating at this place because every time I leave I'm completely satisfied. I just wish it wasn't so far away.
author: Cristelle J.

description:
OMG!  If I could eat here daily, I would.  I would probably also die of a big, fat, heart attack :-)  It would be worth it though.

Half a chicken and two sides for $6.99 - and I could barely finish my meal.
Not only was it affordable, but it was DELICIOUS!   

I will be back.... again and again... until I die of my heart attack with a big smile on my face, clutching my chest, uttering, "It was all for the love Pete's".
author: Lauren C.

description: Ehhh, I feel like I'm a connoisseur of BBQ and this place did not really do it for me. The BBQ sauce is too salty and the meat did not fall off the bones. I don't mind a dingy and dirty looking place, but if it isn't delicious, I'd rather not put up with it. I suppose if I lived in the Mission and this was the closest BBQ place, I would not mind. But, why settle when there are much better options? Price isn't bad though; running around $15/person.
author: Angela L.

description:
This place is delish. This is the kind of bbq sauce I wish I could find in farmers markets when I try the healthy vegan version. I took the 1/4 chicken meal to-go to Jackson Park near my school. People were getting together to play baseball. I grubbed. Yes, they do slap the butter on, but that's the thing, they slap it on, you take it off the bread, easy. 

Dip bread in bbq sauce. Repeat. 

Macaroni salad was awesome as in not sour, which is awesome. Chicken is very tender.
Going again tomorrow with boyfriend for ribs.
author: Mary H.

description:
The turkey sandwiches are to die for.  I get them only once in a while, because they totally put me into a food coma for the rest of the day.  

But, if you get a hankering for that Thanksgiving leftovers-style sandwich, this is the only place to go.  If you ask nicely, they'll even make it with all dark meat, the way I like it!  

Yes, I'm going tonight.  For some reason I didn't take home leftovers from Turkey Day yesterday.  I need more turkey!  Thanks, Pete.
author: J Liberty S.

description:
What do you know, it works out perfectly:  I gave Baby Blues four stars and George's  two.  Pete's Barbeque is exactly in between those two.

Service was like George's in that it's mostly a 'go-down-the-line' cafeteria style deal.  I had the ribs and the brisket.  The ribs were decent; not great but not bad either.  However, the brisket was meat-coma inducing.  Those that know me know I love meat in my mouth.  This was good enough to have me sitting there for at least 15 minutes, just chewing and savoring.  Not the best brisket I've ever had, but pretty good.

Worth checking out if you're in the area, but for my money, I'd still rather go to Baby Blues.  Although the quest for the best BBQ in San Francisco continues.
author: Zhi Q.

description:
THE FOOD:
Chicken, roast beef, baked potatoes. This is NOT a southern BBQ, don't expect cornbread, baked beans, greens or anything like that.  The sides are potato, macaroni, tree bean and tomato/cucumber type of salads. 

VALUE:
I decided to try something different and went for the spaghetti and sausage. For under $10 I got a BIG portion of pasta, a side and a soda. It also comes with bread and butter, but I didn't want any. Their version of spaghetti sort of tasted like bay leaf and something else I can't put my finger on - maybe a hint of cinnamon or nutmeg? I got a side of tomato and cucumber salad. It came dressed in  white vinegar and oil, with raw onions and specked with pepper. I enjoyed it, nothing fancy but very satisfying. 

SERVICE:
These guys know how to cut up meat. There's also two super efficient Latina ladies at the counter, moving things along.  This place seems to always be crowded yet the wait is not long at all.

THE "ATMOSPHERE"
It is the Mission folks, someone got killed across the street just recently, yet I'm so glad small businesses like this one survive. Again, nothing fancy. It has the feeling of an old diner, with its old vinyl and formaica tables. The food also has a "1950's home made" quality to it, back when meat was the main part of the meal. The sides have that "church potluck" feeling...you either love them or you hate them.  Yet, there is something very endearing and honest about this place.
author: Raul A.

description:
Solid and cheap meat and potatoes type of place, but Tommy's Joynt is a cut above. Similar setup to Chick and Coop in the Excelsior. 

Came here with my roommate and on meat-eating quest. We liked the way that you could just order the meat alacarte and didn't have to order meals. Here's the rundown

Ribs -  probably the best thing we had. Falling off the bone, great meaty flavour, not obscured by bbq sauce.

Turkey leg - again falling off the bone. I'm not a fan of turkey, but this was some of the best I've had. I like the way that it wasn't smokey like the turkey legs always seem to be at street fairs. 

Chicken - very tender, but not too flavourful - no additional herbs etc. Like Costco's but slightly better.

Roast Beef - this was atrocious. Overcooked and super dry. 

We also got a salad, baked potato and bread roll...altogether only $25 for a mountain of food! Liked the old school feel although service was a bit lacking.
author: Jeremy H.

description: I have been eating Pete's since I was like 10 and man they ALWAYS have good chicken and my favorite part is the breast & wings.  It is truly one of the best BBQ places in the Bay Area.  I usually get a plate with a quarter chicken drenched in their yummy BBQ sauce (sometimes I ask for a tub to go, sooo good) with a baked potato and a side bread all for only $6 something.  The workers there are all very nice and remember you after a few visits.  Do not miss out, if you're in the Mission and haven't tried this place yet, skip the burrito today and have some BBQ!
author: Christina O.

description:
Are you a hard working middle class american that likes simple no frilles in your face restaurants like Tad's but just wish all the tourists would go to hell and die?  Then Pete's is your place. It is like this place was ripped right out of Chicago, Philly, or Brooklyn and placed here for hard working folks to enjoy a square meal.

The menu is simple...can you put it on a stick and turn it on a  spit? Then it will be there. Chicken, ribs, roast beef, turkey...all rottisserie.

Lets get it straight, this place is not a "Bar B que" joint in the traditional sense, its a rottisserie.  

Minus one star for a sauce that never seems to be the same - one day ambrosia of the gods, the next day piss of hades.

Don't get it twisted and think this place has the best tasting food on the Planet....it doesn't. 
It provides OK tasting food, excellent portions, super price, and rather OK service. 

If you are a weak ass or are just super soft you should NOT come within 100ft of this place.
author: Spanky M.

description: As some BBQ experts have pointed out, this technically is a rotisserie but in any case, it's very good.  You can get Chicken, Sausage, Ribs, etc and any combination along with sides such as baked potato, bread, salad, corn, etc.  The meats are very flavorful and with the sides, your hunger is sure to be tamed.  Some classic 49ers posters from the 80's adds to the character of this blue collar place where you get a lot for your money, but I won't take a date here.
author: Marc S.

description:
So the secret to Pete's is the turkey sandwich on a sourdough roll.
Have them dunk both sides of your bread in the beef drippings. Add the turkey both light and dark meat and a little of the flavored turkey skin. Add a little lettuce, tomato and salt and pepper. Now that's a sandwich!
author: A C.

description: Pete's BBQ"s Chicken and Ribs never disappoint, when I used to live in San Francisco I would always stop by and eat there delicious BBQ Ribs and there delicious Chicken and now that I live in San Lorenzo CA I don't usually come to this place like used to but If I'm hungry for some ribs and chicken I would drive all the way from San Lorenzo CA to San Francisco CA to eat me some Pete's BBQ Chicken and Ribs =D
author: Jose C.

description:
I had the chicken.  First of all, what it all looks like in the trays doesn't look too sanitary.  The spaghetti is gross looking, like all brownish.  The chicken was edible but I had to drown it in tons of sauce.  After living in Dallas for 2 years, this place is a sad excuse for a BBQ dinner.  I feel like I just ate a cow.  I guess I'll give it 2 stars because it was edible.
Update 9:30pm: I think I need to break out the Pepto Bismol
author: Mitch A.

description: I love their chicken. Their baked potatoes could be a little better. But I tried a slice of the apple pie and yum! Friendly enough staff.
author: Alexandra A.

description: had the chicken and slaw, great, even the dinner roll was quality.  dont bother with the bbq sauce though, we liked it better sans sauce.  if your thinking about it or were like us and just needed a little something to hold you over its well worth it.
author: Shawn B.

description:
It's not exactly "barbeque". It's more like, rotisserie covered in barbeque sauce. I prefer to have my sauce on the side. 

You fall in a cafeteria-style line and wait your turn. I usually take mine to go and eat it in the comfort of my own home. I usually get a half chicken and a pound of ribs. Maybe a baked potato if I'm really hungry, but I always have some leftover for the next day. Great spot if you're looking for cheap eats in the Mission, but are bored of taquerias.
author: Zell C.

description:
So many 3 Star reviews!!

First off, the price ain't too bad, rather good in my opinion.

The food is delicious.  I can't get enough of the half rib quarter chicken meal with my baked potato with lb of butter in it with my many salad choices.  

In fact, when I'm feeling good, I get that extra BBQ sauce.  That's right, EXTRA BBQ SAUCE.  It's the sauce that makes all the difference.  Nothing tastes better.

"Why not 5 Stars?" you may be asking.  Simple, not a lot of parking and we still got those crazy crips on the corner from time to time.  But hey, you GOTTA LOVE THE MISSION!
author: Mike V.

description:
Eh, some of you young'uns dont get it.... Pete's is an INSTITUTION!

I dont get over there as much as I did 20 years ago or so.... but I still love it. Pete is there for the masses. I've seen them open on Thanksgiving... Christmas.... feeding folks.   Everyone is treated equally regardless of their appearance....  Pete remembers all of the old timers.....  

Right, they dont take credit cards and they are not fancy. But the food is good, the price reasonable........ these are honest, hard working people and I"m glad they are still there.... (it's also been the SAME guys all these years...)
author: linda b.

description:
POTATOES ROASTED IN CHICKEN FAT. 

need i say more? juices from about 25 fat succulent roasting chickens drip down into the pan where the potatoes lay bathing.  soooo good!  with a giant ice cream scoop-sized mound of butter on top.  (my sister and i walked by one day before i'd eaten there and watched one of the servers plop the humongous hunk of butter onto the potato and she immediately said, "that's my new girlfriend.")  and of course i added sour cream when i got it home.  i'm craving that potato right now.  $1.25.

the whole rotisserie chicken was delectable too, very juicy, pulled from the rail steaming hot, juices bubbling under the surface of the crackling skin, seconds before it was carved into quarters and stuffed into an aluminum-lined bag.  sauce or no sauce or on the side?  on the side please - and a very good bbq sauce it was.  so nice & smoky.   we got there at 6:30, and everyone seemed to know this was the time to arrive - people were lined up waiting for the chickens to come out of the rotisserie.  i think you can call ahead and reserve one.

we wanted to try the ribs too, but they weren't going to be ready and we were starving, so we tried the roast beef instead.  very nice and tender, red-rare (or whatever you like); only thing is it was kinda cold.  

a very serviceable fresh-tasting tomato, lettuce, oregano, cucumber  & onion salad did the trick to finish the meal off.  $19 for a whole chicken, 1/2 a pound of roast beef, two baked potatoes, and a large salad - find me a better deal than that!

the place itself looks divey and dirty, but who cares?  they also serve a greasy looking spaghetti with big sausage-like things, and a macaroni & potato salad.  none of that looked any good to me.  oh, and they roast a whole turkey every day.  

they guys behind the counter are Greek, the women Latinas - they're all really nice and quick and friendly.  as my sister said, they know what to do with butter.
author: maria a.

description:
Okay so from the pictures this place looks like the average deli joint which it is.  But damn no offense to anyone, but Pete's is located in the rough areas of SF.  I was uninformed of the type of location from the yelp reviews before suggesting my family (we're from so.Cal) and my sf-local friend to eat here.  Parking is metered on the streets, where I was slightly paranoid because we came in a CLS and my friends Audi A4.  To compare, it was as close as you can get to eating in downtown l.a.

Anyway about the food: Large portions for the price (expect to spend around $8-10 person). Bread that they give you is rough and stale; I would ask for no bread rather than letting it go to waste.  Mac Salad was very good, light on the mayo and saltiness, nice texture to the macaroni.  The bbq sauce is decent, a bit salty but cant complain for the price and how it fills you up.  

Workers here were surprisingly friendly to my party. The old bbq guy remembered I was waiting for the ribs and held the line up (that was out the door) to serve me my food. In conclusion, come here dressed low-key, come during the DAYTIME, stick with the chicken and mac salad, fear the stale bread!
author: Andrew C.

description:
I tried the half chicken dinner and it was off the hook.
They give you enough food for you to pass out after your meal.
The place doesnt have a lot of space inside or a parking lot but the food is good. I grew up eating this but hadn't had it for a while maybe 7 years or so and it's still great.
author: Los m.

description:
I had a BBQ Chick to go and picked up for lunch.  I was surprisingly satisfied with the half Chicken (all white meat) .  It was moist and tasty. my skin was missing though, which is my favorite part.  and the sauce was yummy, it had a light BBQ sauce taste with some peppery taste so it a was a little spicy and had a nice zing to it. 
I had the sandwiches here before and they are great, not your little weighed and pre-measured meat portions but a hearty amount so you can taste the savory meat rather than just tasting the bread & lettuce, tomato & pickles. 2 thumbs up for Pete's BBQ.
author: gordon g.

description:
The turkey sandwich is practically 2 meals. It weighs a ton! I actually brought one to a Giants game once and it was heavy enough to weigh down the purse shelf in the bathroom stall. (It was still wrapped and in a plastic bag, don't worry.) People around me were asking where I got it, too.

Super friendly and hardworking staff as well. My boyfriend and I see them prepping for the day's meals before 7am everyday and they don't even open until 10.
author: Jennie H.

description:
I'm downgrading this to a 1 considering the proper bbq I've had around the country recently. It really doesn't compare at all. Even in the bay area, if you want good bbq, go to the brick pig house in Oakland. The owners are cool, its cheap and the food is amazing.

If I want Pete's style, roasted chicken in future I think I'll go to safeway.  This place is uncomfortable to sit down in too and the staff weren't exactly over friendly so I'm not going back. The standard of food in SF is way to high to revisit Pete's so I guess you could say my interest has Peter'd out.
author: Dave F.

description:
WOW. yes WOW. Pete's BBQ is one of my favorite spots when I'm in the Mission area. I would drive from the Sunset all the way there just to order my quarter special ..thigh ( xtra sauce) with the macaroni side and the oh so yummy baked potato! 

It's a small place on the corner...but you can smell the aroma from a block away! When you first step foot in there, you will notice to your left that there a whole thing of rotisserie chicken along with ribs and potatoes spinning inside. So you know the food moves quick in there! There is always a line! I haven't been there once where it was empty. Always?!?

The lunch special usually fills me up but I have finished a lunch with half a small chicken before too. They have different sides that you can choose  like spaghetti , potato salad, the MAC salad (yum!), and there's a few trays down but I usually stop right there. Their sausage is pretty good too. My friends and I try to get different things while we're there so we can share. Yeeea...it's a great idea at the time, but when you're enjoying the food... you can imagine how much sharing really goes on.
For the price you get a lot of food and when you're waiting in line, look around... you'll see a lot of locals and there's history there! :)
author: Sandra C.

description:
It's pretty good, but it's not really a bbq place.  Most stuff are roasted.  

The sandwiches are pretty good, I love their bread and potato.  

I personally like the chicken better than the ribs, but some days you just HAVE to get ribs, you know?

I definitely come here mostly because it's cheap.   But for the price, I think it's an excellent place.
author: Anthonio C.

description:
It's been awhile since I've reviewed anything.  

Pete's is the place for RIBS.

You can smell the ribby goodness from 3 blocks in all directions from the spot.

Fall off the bone and slap your mama kind of good.  They cut up your ribs off a slab and LATHER it with delicious sauce. 

UH-huh.
The only reason that they aren't getting 5 stars is because they don't have mac-n-cheese...I mean WTF, what goes better than ribs and mac?
Also, they almost universally close before they're supposed to by anywhere from 15-25 minutes, which stinks if you busted your tail to get there.

One of the guys there is really cute too. 
Run, don't walk to Pete's!
author: Nathalie P.

description: Best bbq I've had in the city! The atmosphere of the place may seem questionable at first, but their meat is very high quality and always tender and juicy. I've tried other bbq places but none have been nearly as good as Pete's!
author: Devon K.

description: excellent restaurant if you like BBQ's. I mostly take food to go and eat at home because restaurant is small . Owner "Pete" is one of a kind. The bbq sauce is like no other. I highly recommend this place The food is fabulous! only one drawback: the parking, it sux!
author: Que T.

description: Love their chicken, sides, bread, meats, have not tried the ribs yet so can't comment on them but in general this place (which I have been coming to for a good 15yrs) is amazing and consistant. I would highly recommend! Decent prices (which in this economy is important) too!
author: Bella B.

description:
The chicken is sooo good, so juicy never dry and always consist ant! Prices ain't bad either! 

Parking sucks when it's the weekend, so we tend to pick some up during the week. If the craving is that bad on the weekend, we usually drop someone off to get it loop the block a few times or sit in the bus zone and we're off!!

Sides are pretty good, some people I know love their spaghetti, but it doesn't wow me! But 5 stars for the chicken!!!!!!!!!!!
author: M R.

description: Went here with my girlfriend for dinner. We had their Chicken and Ribs dinner combo. Food was delicious and tasty. Their chicken was marinated good and with their delicious bbq sauce. Meat was soft and fall off the skin. Home cooking food. Would recommend to try.
author: Gruber T.

description:
i used to live 2 blocks from this place when i was little and now that i live in sacramento, i can still say that everytime i'm in sf i HAVE to go to pete's for my fix! and if ever my parents are in the city i always tell them to bring me home a plate of it too =)

i've been of a big fan of this place for over 20 years and if i had to have one last meal before i die i'd probably pick petes bbq =)

i usually order the 1/2 chicken dinner with MAS salsa (bbq sauce), macaroni salad, baked potato and bread.

sometimes it gets a lil packed in there so there are gonna be some days when you will be sitting with random people since this place doesn't seat many people =) but all you gonna is think about the goodness of that tasty eats =)
author: Rachele B.

description:
I can only talk about their rotisserie chicken ( without the BBQ sauce) but they are in par with rotisserie chickens you get in any weekly markets in France. I am pretty sure they get their chicken from somewhere special, without the right ingredients, they can't get this level of perfection in texture and taste.

Their chicken easily beat the rotisserie chickens in chains like Safeway or Whole Foods.

Great addition to my grocery shopping in the Mission.
author: J I.

description:
The chicken here is more rotisserie than bbq but the sauce brings it over (get it on the side).  Definitely one of the best take-home-chicken dinners in the city.  Better than Safeway but not better that Costco.  
The ribs are excellent but the sausage is OK.  A filling dinner with a drink will run you about 8 bucks but definitely take it to go unless you don't mind eating in the cafeteria.
author: Pablo R.

description: Pete's is great. A home-style cooked meal with some of those savory tender ribs, half chicken, buttered potato and a home roll. All i'm asking for is a glass of home made kool aid to go with it. I came in here on a sunny saturday not knowing anything beforehand, and was extremely impressed. Foods so good, it brings back that nostalgic feeling of a Kentucky afternoon, while grandad tends to the BBQ out in the yard. The BBQ sauce is very hickory smoked and tasty, it will keep you coming back for sure. Affordable as well, can't go wrong by any means.
author: Jeremy N.

description: This place is always packed.  It's your basic BBQ plate with meat, potatoes, some mediocre side options.  All for cheap, served cafeteria-style.  Awesome people watching from the corner windows.  Copious margarine on the potato and roll.  Nice people too.
author: Eric S.

description: Ninja took home a whole rotisserie bbq'd chicken from Pete's BBQ  and the meat was quite moist and juicy. I even tried their own barbeque sauce and it had a nice smoky, tangy and sweetness to it. It was worth dipping the breast meat in!
author: Mika D.

description:
If I did not growing up eating here then I would probably give it four stars, but this place is comfort food for me.  I eat here at least once a week because I think the food is excellent and it is not pricey.  

While I acknowledge that this place is not a classic bbq place, in the sense that is not does not have a southern identity and they roast their ribs instead of cooking them in a smoker, the food here is still down right good.  

I either get the chicken or the roasted turkey sandwich.  The chickens are a good size and they are always perfectly cooked.  The meat is always tender and juicy.

The roasted turkey sandwiches are great.  They cut the meat straight from the turkey and serve a huge helping.  I always ask them to serve me less meat, and they never do, they just file it on.  

They do not have corn bread or multiple styles ob BBQ sauce like classic BB joints, but the sauce they serve is tasty.
author: Jaime T.

description: YUM!!!! THis bar-b-que is so good! Used to come here as a kid, and it always brings back memories! The only complaint I have, is that I wish the servers would use gloves, and hairnets when handling food!!!! Kind of grosses me out, I wish they were more hygenic!!!!
author: Gabriel T.

description:
The best baked potatoes I've ever had!!!!!!! and from an irishman that's one hell of a compliment. 
Respectablly good slow roast tangy/spicey (not sweet) BBQ. Home cookin sides just perfect for takeout pick-a-nick over at Delores Park. I've learned that true slow roast BBQ is not only fall off the bone tender but if cooked proper ( Slooooooowly ) the bones should be tender as well, just like pete's.
What we had : I got the half rack dinner (extra,extra sauce), BAKED POTATOE, potatoe salad, and buttered roll. NG got half chicken, baked potatoe, salad, and buttered roll. $18.45  Pete me likeah your price, your price is good.
author: t h.

description:
This BBQ Joint has to be considered a mission landmark!
They have been around since the donut place across the street was still making donuts and serving up Icee's with there neon sign of a donut falling into a cup of coffee. Now you have a drug store that replaced the donut shop.

So Pete's BBQ has stood through the test of time. 
This is the place to feel like a native San Franciscan. My family has been coming here since the 70's. 
Their BBQ chicken and baked potato still tastes the same as when I remember going here when I was a kid. 

I have always enjoyed their selection of food, and really enjoy the bread that is included. A nice way to soak up all the extra BBQ sauce I requested.

So come and experience what myself and my family have been enjoying since the 70's!
author: Alfonso C.

description: Seriously...  I couldn't be happier to have discovered this place.  The food here will make you HAPPY (period).  This is no doubt the best place for BBQ in the City.  Melt in your mouth taste & tenderness. You can't beat the price for such great comfort food.  We usually get a chicken and some sides to go since the seating is minimal.
author: Robert W.

description: Good home-style rotisserie chicken, albeit a little dry without the spicy BBQ sauce.  Really delicious macaroni salad.  Spaghetti was pretty good too!
author: Susan H.

description:
I ventured into Pete's today with a buddy half way through a day's house moving at around 1:30. I stopped for a large burrito 2 hours before so I had no intention of eating. I just came with my buddy for the company. That changed when I saw the food!
It looked, smelled and tasted great! This is an old timey meat and potatoes type of place so if you are a vegan or vegetarian or health conscious person this ain't for you! If you like tasty, fatty, grub in a no frills atmosphere then come on down!
author: Richie S.

description:
Pete's has great rotisserie chicken. The barbeque sauce is one of the more subtle, delicious recipes I've had. The chicken was cooked well, and the backed potato was delicious despite (or because of?) the massive slab of butter dolloped on top. The cole slaw was particularly tasty with a perfectly balanced consistency.
I also got a great vibe from the staff. This may be an SF institution, but the staff certainly doesn't have a chip on their shoulders about it. 
This is as good as it gets for price/quantity/quality ratio.
author: kaizar C.

description: run...don't walk...to Pete's. It's like your dad cooking you and home-made dinner (if your dad could cook, which mine never did), so good, it was cathartic. Do you know how many times I have eaten here? I want to marry the baked potatoes. And Pete.
author: Susanne A.

description: I saw this place from the street so I went on in. I was initially disappointed. Inside it seemed less than average. I got the ribs and I'll definitely be going back to get more.
author: Josh E.

description:
I had the spare ribs dinner today.  Just over $10 for 3 big pork spare ribs, a baked potato, your choice of salad (macaroni, potato, 3-bean, others I didn't pay attention to), and a big buttered roll.  This review reflects that particular dish.

The reviews of Pete's BBQ have proven to me that most Yelpers have terrible taste.  I can't even fathom how anybody could call this the best BBQ they've ever eaten.

1)  This is not BBQ.  The meat is not smoked.

2)  The sauce is salty, anemic, and sad.

The texture of the ribs was good.  It could've used a little more time, but was sufficiently tender and moist.  Better than being overcooked and mushy (ribs are NOT supposed to "fall off the bone").

The rub tastes more or less like salt and pepper, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.  I could tell by the color that there's some other spice(s) in there, but the flavor didn't come through.

The baked potato was good, supplemented only by a big slab of butter.  The skin was seasoned and possibly lightly basted in the sorry sauce before baked, which gave it a bit of a gooey crus that I liked.  A bit of salt and pepper to taste and it was good eatin.  It's possible this was accidental as my friend's potato skin looked plain and dry.

The macaroni salad was a typical mayonnaise based concoction with a healthy dose of black pepper and a little chopped parsley.  Slightly sweet, but mostly mayo-ey.

I liked the roll.  Soft and moist inside with a chewy crust.  Fairly substantial and not too light and pillowy or spongy.  It was like a good mini-sized sandwich roll.  Perfect for making a little sandwich out of the meat, in fact!

On taste alone I would give it 2.5 stars, but it is a lot of food for relatively little money that is certainly edible and can really hit the spot, so +1 star for that.  It's also very fast, cafeteria style service.  Good for lunch, if you don't have to go through the trouble of finding parking.

Do not come here expecting soul-soothing, spirit-lifting, divine smoked 'que.  Do come here if you want something cheap, filling, meaty, and real (not processed, fast food).  I'm a discerning eater, but not picky so I'll probably be coming back here from time to time.
author: Eugene L.

description: Now that I've been living in the neighborhood, I've been taking small steps to visit ol' spots from my childhood. I recently stopped by Pete's for some chicken and ribs with my brother. The rotisserie chicken still continues to be one of the best around. With so many new and fancy BBQ spots (and snobs) out there, no doubt that you'll find "better" ribs than Pete's. So if you're looking for a good "meat and potatoes" kind-of meal with some local nostalgia, Pete's Barbeque is where it's at!
author: Leroid D.

description: Wanted to check out Yat's for some po' boys but it was closed, being a sunday. figured some bbq would be a good alternative, ended up at pete's and it was solid. price-wise, taste-wise and quantity-wise. if you're in the mission and feel like bbq, go to pete's.
author: Vivek S.

description: I don't view this place as much of a bbq place but more as a Chicken and Coup type place. Reminds me of a hof brau. They do rotisserie chicken, ribs, roast beef, dinner and sandwich plates. It's very simple fair such as potato salad, macaroni salad etc. I got the ribs since I am in dire search of a good bbq joint. The bbq sauce was vinegary and smokey which I like but the ribs were probably cooked in the same rotisserie oven as the chicken but not falling off the bone tender and kinda lacked flavor. But that's my fault for getting the ribs.  Having been to places like this I usually get the roast beef or the chicken and you can't go wrong. The portions are great and its a great deal. I'll be going back for the chicken next time.
author: Hyung L.

description: If your in the Mission, stop by this hidden gem. Half Chicken dinner with 2 sides (potato & mac salad), roasted potato with drippings from the chicken spit, sour roll, snapple. Ask for MAS salsa (bbq sauce). FTW
author: Jenric H.

description: Seriously GREAT food and HEALTHY SIZED PORTIONS! I am one of those people who can't even walk away full at an all you can eat buffet. I eat. I eat a lot. I consider restaurant food a complete utter waste of money, primarily because I can never get full. This place has just about the best chicken around, and the portions are far from skimpy. I kinda dig the vibe here, it's very authentic San Francisco, old school butcher shop kinda. Mafia? I don't know. Sorta like the old decor and furnishings from when 'Alice' was a sit com. You definitely get the idea that the 'soup nazi' character on 'Sienfeld' was based loosely on someone connected to this joint. And I don't mean that in a bad way. It just is whatever it is. Something there I can't put a finger on. But I like it. Very reasonably priced. No real butter for the baked potatoes though, just cheap margarine crap. Seriously, wtf. I cannot deal with that stuff.
author: Richard V.

description: Glory Be! It's all about the damn chicken and the potato here. All the other sidesis what I skip out on because some of them are half lackluster. But this is all I need on a summer day, eat it there or take that shit to go, wash it down with a cold glass of kool aid and a 40 oz. and you will be feeling good.
author: Davy L.

description: So it called Barbeque, but it not really Barbeque it more like a rotiserie food place with the use of oven as the main "Grill". The neighborhood scary and not to safe to walk along at night, it better go there with friends so you will feel more safe. The chicken was good and juicy, the manager (pete? asked me every time if I wants juicy with my chicken, i did tried both styles and I like them all. The baked potato was fine a little dry but it served with butter which made it more juicy. the salad was ok yep... just ok. Pete's is not the best food place to eat a top meal, but if you just hangry and pass  by grab a chicken and a salad which will be ok for a small lunch break if you in the area.
author: Ron F.

description: i grew up on this place.  yes its ghetto, and no its not that organic local stuff..  but it is delicious, and the price is right.  yum.
author: Kimby T.

description: I've been going to Pete's for years and love the great rotissserie. The rotisserie turkey sandwich is way too good for the price! Best place to go for a REAL turkey sandwich. Put some homemade BBQ sauce on it and it's killer! The ribs just melt off the bone and that sauce is really good. The chicken is good too. The baked potato w/ simple butter is delicious. The salads are good too. Cheap + good = a winner. I think that place has been there for like some 20 years.
author: Rolostar ..

description: 1st visit to Pete's, after walking past for the four years that I've lived around the corner. It's nothing to write home about, but I not only wrote home about it, but took pictures and let everyone I could think of know what I had just had for dinner. It would be fair to say that Pete's is a good place to go for the romanticism of getting bbq take-out from an old school cafeteria type diner, but not to go if you actually want a good meal.
author: This L.

description: After reading yelp reviews I thought I was in for a great treat....well the trick was on me.  The ribs (4) were tough and did not fall off the bone - potato was not HUGE and there was barely any butter.  Sauce was just OK and the price not that great.....still searching for the best BBQ in SF
author: Diana D.

description: I have never actually sat down here and ate nor have I ever ordered their plates. I usually just order a whole chicken and take it to go. Their chicken is really tasty and the BBQ sauce is really good. I just wish it was closer to where I live.
author: Diane M.

description:
love this place.  i always buy too much food when i'm in here.  i'll think that i'll have enough to stomach a 1/2 chicken & some ribs, including sides...but it just wayyyyyy too much food.

$7 gets you a half chicken, bread, a baked potato & two sides.  

thinking about it now, it's not really a bbq place, it's more of a rotisserie deli.  

get here before lunch cause the line can be out the door.
author: Ray R.

description: Throw your hands in the air. Wave 'em like ya just don't care and say MEAT-O....love quality and reasonably-priced bbq'd meat? Then this is the place for you. Be prepared for the ribs. I absolutely loved it with their buttery baked potato goodness. A pound of ribs may be a bit too heavy but, by god, it's so good you'll even want to eat the charred remains. And, yeah, I did.
author: Cecilia A.

description: Best. baked. potato. ever. And it comes with amazing, tender, rotisserie chicken with sauce and bread and macaroni salad. It's pretty much the best meal you could get for $7.59. Baked potatos are my favorite food and these are sooooo good, tender, fluffy and the put a giant glob of margarine on it too. Not butter, margarine. Five stars.
author: Cathy T.

description: Good cheap bbq eats. You can get a whole dinner with a quarter chicken,  french bread, and two sides for like $5.95. I ask for extra bbq sauce - it's yummy. But like the other reviewers mentioned, it's not really "real" bbq - but still tasty.
author: Peter S.

description: Fine homestyle cooking. I can't imagine going here on a regular basis due to the assumed amount of butter and oil they're using, but my oh my was that some good chicken and mashed potatoes.
author: Joshua K.

description: What this isn't: an actual BBQ place, so far Johnson's the the best I've found for that in the city. What it is: pretty decent rotisserie chicken in a pretty good BBQ sauce. The sides were nothing special, edible, but I'd probably just get the chicken and a roll in the future. I'll likely give their ribs a try next time I stop by. Good place to pick up a quick and reasonably good lunch. I'll eat there again, but won't be rushing back.
author: Ross M.

description: Pretty good BBQ place in the mission.  The chicken with BBQ sauce is really good, and you can order it with a baked potato and a choice of salads.  The salads aren't all that great, but the chicken and ribs are solid, and it's relatively cheap.  I rotate between here and popeyes for my finger licking fix.
author: Daniel W.

description: I just got home from eating at this place and I must say I wouldn't consider this as Barbeque. The food is cooked on a rotisserie but is still good. The price for the food is decent and the amount of food is considerate. I would come back again when I want ribs and I'm too lazy to drive anywhere else. I wouldn't make this a regular spot but it does its job when I want ribs.
author: Lucky M.

description: So my sister and I came upon this little gem on accident, while shopping in the mission area. I had heard that it's quite the neat place to grab a hearty bite, so we decided to try it. The grungy cafeteria experience is great ( I LOVE grungy, unpretentious places!), and the food was quite exciting...until we took a bite. I think something was went wrong that day, cuz all the meat was INCREDIBLY SALTY. If it wasn't for the saltiness, I would have loved it. The ribs were tender and not dry at all, and the bbq sauce was great...but maybe they accidentally dumped salt onto the meat?? LOVED the macaroni salad. Hopefully next time it won't be so salty...I'm willing to try it again!
author: yeana j.

description: I can't believe that I've been living in this city for so many years and still finding places that I haven't tried before. Especially when it's right in our neighborhood. I got my first taste of Pete's last night and I know I'm going back! I've never had rotisserie chicken covered with BBQ sauce so this was a first for me. You get the best of both worlds. I believe that rotisserie is the best way to cook a chicken and when you top if off with Pete's BBQ sauce...magic! The coleslaw ain't bad either! A family was hovering over me waiting for me to vacate the table so I'm sure I could have enjoyed it even more if I wasn't rushed. Can't wait to go back...maybe try take out next time!
author: Reza E.

description: I don't know whether it was the rotisserie chickens roasting in the window, or the smell of the place wafting toward my house in the mission that brought me in, but few places make me feel like I got really well fed on a low budget, this is definitely one of them.  You can get a half of a roasted chicken, large portions of mashed potatoes and your choice of salad, and bread and butter all for like $8.00 and it is super good.  I love this place and can't wait to go back.  If you are a student or on a budget as I am, I would definitely recommend it, you WILL be well fed!
author: Jonathan M.

description: Good rotisserie chicken, tender, falls off the bone, yet still moist.  Sauce drowned out all the flavor though.  Bread was not toasted.  Salad was surprisingly good (it tasted like a greek salad yet without the feta or olives if that makes any sense).  I have to try the ribs before I readjust the rating of my sauce impaired chicken quarter dinner.  Baked potato did not come with anything more than butter.  Friendly staff.  Good value.
author: H C.

description: Not the widest selection of bbq food, basically there's chicken, beef ribs, sausage and few side dishes like coleslaw and mashed potatoes. The food is alright, but not awesome and I found it to be a bit salty. The best thing is probably the chicken. Everything is priced are pretty reasonable, but I'd probably look elsewhere for bbq if that's your craving.
author: Eric O.

description: Today I was reminded on how good the food is here. I had turkey sandwich with lettuce and jue sauce yumm... The turkey was done rotisserie style then hand carved it into my sandwich. They also serve rotisserie style chicken and ribs delicious and a variety of freshly made salads. The help here is very helpful and they are eager to serve. Its not in the best part of town nor do they have adequate seating but besides that this place screams good food.
author: Carolina H.

description: Good food at an afforable price.  The rotissiere chicken is probably the best thing on the menu.
author: James C.

description: For such an "establishment" place, I expected better. Nothing on the menu or in the bins in front of me really excited me. I ended up with a roast beef sandwich. I didn't like that they didn't have a pulled pork sandwich - my all-time BBQ favorite thing to get. Plus, they close really freakin' early! 8pm!
author: Stu M.

description: So this dive is located in the thick of Mission St. and run by a bunch of hairy Greek dudes. How some Ouzo drinkin MOFO's started makin barbeque in the Mission is a mystery to me but Greek Orthodox God Bless em'.  How I do Love all the greasy goodness runnin down my face. Don't come here if you got a sissy la la stomach and yer gonna complain bout how "it's only good cuz it's bad for you". NO SH!T!!!!! this ain't a review for Herbivore JACKA$$!!
author: santiago g.

description: I am a little biased as this is a childhood memory of mine.  The smell which you can smell for blocks of roasting BBQ brings back the days when dad used to buy this for the family as a special treat- usually on pay day if I remember.  Going as an adult - I appreciate the Mission District and the people.  Dont' expect anything fancy - there are about 5 tables and 3 counter chairs.  You can have options like ribs, turkey, sausage, spaghetti, and for myself the famous Chicken.  It's a bit pricey, but the BBQ is unique and flavorful... meat tender.  You have different options of sides...I usually get the green salad which is already mixed with a variety of things like cucumbers and vinegar.  You also get a roll which already has a pat of butter in side waiting for you to spread.  The drink options aren't that spectacular:  Coke and/or Snapple.  What I like is that this is a family restaurant still in business solely for their BBQ.
author: Neville B.

description: Best fresh roast beef sandwich in town!
author: jordan t.

description: if youre looking for real bbq.  this is not the place.  maybe it was because we went at the end of the night, i dunno.. but i was not satisfied.   first off, the menu is really limited.  no brisket? and why is spaghetti on the menu?  as soon as i walked in i noticed the huge amount of meat sitting on the counter.  then i noticed the microwave.  this place is a total reheat operation.  who knows when the meat was cooked?  yesterday, 3 days ago? last weekend? anyone's guess.   a real bbq place you walk in and smell bbq cooking!  not waiting for you in piles like last weekends leftovers.  and its not bbq!  its rotissery chicken, masked with bbq sauce.  as we were eating, they were closing up and just throwing foil on top of all of the meat to throw back into the fridge.  i'm no health expert, but isn't it not good to continually move meat in and out of the fridge, subjecting it to multiple temperature changes over and over.  i mean it was alot of meat.  how long do they plan on serving it?  sure at home we do leftovers, but when you go dine out, you want fresh food, cooked to order.  i got the combo plate which came with a super cold bread roll.  the soda was literally the best part of my meal. i had to have humphry slowcombe ice cream afterwards just so i wouldnt feel so gross.  i think i was just bugged out by ordering food and getting microwaved stagnant meat.  maybe some of you are fine with that.. but when i go for bbq, that is not what i'm looking for...
author: ces f.

description: this place is so good i first went here to eat last year after a freind of mine told me about this place i remember passing this place when i was a little kid and seeing a long ass line out the door and now i see why there barbque chicken is on hit the spaghetti is hella good and they sell the best baked potatoe i,ve ever ate anywhere i really suggest you try this place out....
author: Jose C.

description: chicken was really good but once you have that roasted chicken at zaki's in albany its kindda hard to give more than 3 stars for anyone , baked potato was ok .  coleslaw is perfect just like it should be , its an avergae place overall , very good prices
author: NAEL K.

description: Read my fellow yelpers reviews.....and tried take out one night.  It was very good. The girls were so sweet and the Greeks ensured we left happy.  I did not mention I was Greek......does it really matter to these hard working men?   The roasted chicken was so good....fresh and cut for our consumption.  The prices are low and the quality is excellent.  I will be back...........Bravo patriotes!!
author: Demetri A.

description: i grew up on this place.  yes its ghetto, and no its not that organic local stuff..  but it is delicious, and the price is right.  yum.
author: kimberly t.

description: good place, good more diner type place, but the food is good, but not quiet texas, but its san francisco what do you expect?
author: Leigh McInnis Lee G.

description: I went to this place expecting to be at the level of the Chick N Coop which I    have always enjoyed. It was very disappointing. Everything about it seemed to suck eggs, to be polite. To start off, they don't accept debit cards, and there are no ATMs nearby which don't charge service fees. Then, there are frequently long lines. That must be because it's so good, right???  Well, the prices seem to be none too low, perhaps higher than the Chick N Coop. I paid over $4 for just two ribs. (I wanted just a snack, not a whole slab.) If  hearing of my having a couple ribs as a snack floors you, congratulations, you'll find kindred spirits in the staff, whose reactions  (facial, verbal and activity)are a cross between if you said "I'm a Martian, and I'm asking you to do rocket science" and a most proper Victorian lady who has received a most improper suggestion, when you ask for anything individually, and not as part of the whole meal. (Maybe, they hire the mentally & emotionally challenged.) Also, I get similar reactions when I (heaven forbid) ask for them not to put mustard on my sandwich, or not to chop up my Polish sausage, which by the way, is flavorless. (Street kiosks actually sell some halfway decent Polish, they don't.) While the spaghetti at the Chick N Coop actually tastes fresh, and like it has some spices in it,  Pete's spaghetti is flavorless. I guess the chicken is as good as the next place, but it is no less expensive, for all the drawbacks of this place, and may be even more expensive.  And it's very virtuous about closing good and early, maybe even before their already early bedtime of 8pm, so I can't even give them props for convenient hours for late night diners.  I just go there when I happen to be in the neighborhood, and I am desperately hungry for hof brau/rotisserie kind of food, but I am trying to find other alternatives.
author: Cat S.

description: like alot of other people have said i wouldn't exactly call it bbq. it's been there forever and i think it's most famous for the rotisserie chicken. but don't forget about the rib though they are also good as well. definetly get the chicken the first time.
author: Ausewaldoe J.
